title: caliber
meaning: measure of the bullets diameter relative to the bore of the firearm

title: extraction length
meaning: total length of the bolt measured from the muzzle of the captive bolt to the tip or head of the bolt

title: insensibility
meaning: state of an animals response specifically to pain

title: overall length
meaning: total length of the captive bolt measured from the bolt head or tip to the opposite end of the equipment including all protruding parts

title: overall weight
meaning: total weight of the captive bolt assembly excluding the blank cartridge or powerload and hose

title: stunning efficacy
meaning: ratio of the number of animals stunned successfully with single application to the total number of animals stunned, expressed in percentage

title: vocalization
meaning: animal sound

title: blank cartridge
meaning: powerload; type of cartridge used in captive bolt that contains gunpowder but without bullet

title: bolt
meaning: metal rod that extrudes from the captive bolt

title: bullet
meaning: round; solid projectile made of metal (usually lead) propelled by a firearm or a gun

title: captive bolt
meaning: stunner that uses kinetic energy to project bolt into the forehead of the animal to render it unconscious.

title: cartridge
meaning: metallic case containing the bullet, gunpowder and the primer

title: stunning
meaning: process of rendering an animal unconscious

title: stunning box
meaning: knocking pen; slaughterhouse equipment used to restrain the animal to facilitate stunning

title: pistol type
meaning: Captive bolt that resembles a pistol or a gun

title: cylinder type
meaning: Captive bolt that resembles a cylindrical tube

title: cartridge type
meaning: Type of mechanical stunner that uses blank cartridge explosion to propel the captive bolt into the forehead of the animal

title: pneumatic type
meaning: Type of mechanical stunner that uses compressed air supplied by a compressor instead of cartridge explosion to propel the captive bolt into the forehead of the animal

title: penetrating type
meaning: Type of captive bolt that drives a concaved bolt tip to penetrate the skull of the animal to severe the brain

title: non-penetrating type
meaning: Type of captive bolt that drives a mushroom-shaped bolt head against the forehead of the animal that causes concussion on the cranium and the brain without penetrating the skull

title: dehairing rate
meaning: number of hogs dehaired per unit time, expressed in heads per hour

title: dehairing time
meaning: actual time of dehairing a single hog, expressed in seconds

title: discharge height
meaning: measurement of the highest position of the J-bar during loading from the base of the machine

title: effective dehairing height
meaning: measurement of the bottom of the J-bars holding chamber from the base of the dehairing machine

title: effective dehairing width
meaning: actual width of the dehairing mechanism measured from both end sides of dehairing paddle parallel to the dehairing shaft

title: evisceration
meaning: removal of the internal organs or entrails of an animal

title: gambreling table
meaning: table used before suspending the carcass for particular operation

title: hair density
meaning: number of hair present per unit area, expressed in hair per square centimeter

title: live weight
meaning: weight of the hog prior to slaughter

title: overall height
meaning: measurement from the topmost point to the base of the machine

title: overall length
meaning: measurement from both sides of the dehairing machine parallel to the discharge side including the protruding parts such as the J-bar lever, motor, etc.*

title: overall width
meaning: measurement of the receiving side of the J-bar to the discharge side in its normal position

title: receiving height
meaning: measurement of the maximum height of the J-bar, in receiving position, from the base of the machine

title: carcass
meaning: body of any slaughtered animal after bleeding and dressing

title: dehairing
meaning: removal of hair from the skin of an animal after scalding as part of the process of preparing its meat for food

title: dehairing capability
meaning: maximum weight of hog a machine is capable of dehairing per loading, expressed in kilograms

title: dehairing efficiency
meaning: ratio of amount of hair removed and the total amount of hair, expressed in percent

title: dehairing machine
meaning: dehairer; mechanical assembly equipped with rotating flexible paddles used in removing hair from animal carcass after scalding

title: dehairing shaft
meaning: high-grade solid steel shaft where scraper paddles are rigidly fastened

title: dehairing wheel
meaning: star wheels; circular bar with radial arms where scraper paddles are attached

title: J bar
meaning: ribbed mechanism that resembles a J- shaped structure that serves as support of the carcass during dehairing and also used in unloading dehaired hog

title: J-bar
meaning: structure that serves as support of the carcass during dehairing and also used in unloading dehaired hog

title: scalding
meaning: subjecting animal into steam or hot water to prepare skin for dehairing

title: scraper blade
meaning: slightly bent steel material attach to the scraper paddle that is used to directly remove the hair

title: scraper paddle
meaning: resilient flexible rectangular block-shaped rubber which serves as a base material for the scraper blade

title: scraper paddle assembly
meaning: composed of three (3) or more paddles with blades attached altogether

title: blade clearance
meaning: distance between two blades in the blade assembly

title: dehiding time
meaning: average time consumed to totally dehide the animal

title: air motor assembly
meaning: part of the handheld flayer that contains the air motor which actuates the movement of the blades by allowing air flow supplied by an air compressor

title: blade assembly
meaning: part of the handheld flayer that is composed mainly by two blades that move in countermotion

title: dehider
meaning: slaughterhouse equipment used to remove the skin from the body of the animal

title: hide
meaning: skin separated from the animal's body

title: hide clamp
meaning: part of the roller drum in vertical puller to which the hide is hooked prior to pulling

title: roller drum
meaning: part of the vertical puller which rolls and pulls the hide to separate it from the carcass

title: handheld flayer
meaning: Type of dehider that is equipped with cutting blades attached to the air motor assembly aided by an air compressor

title: hide puller
meaning: Type of dehider that makes use of roller drum and/or cylinders to pull the hide of the animal away from the body

title: vertical puller
meaning: Type of hide puller that uses roller drum, which is connected to an electric motor, to pull the hide away from the animal's body

title: side puller
meaning: Type of hide puller that makes use of actuating cylinders, either pneumatic or hydraulic, to facilitate the pulling of hide away from the animal's body

title: blood splash
meaning: blood spots or clots formed on the muscle tissue

title: stunning effectivity
meaning: ratio of the total number of hogs stunned successfully to the total number of hogs expressed in percent (%)

title: stunning performance
meaning: ratio of the total number of hogs that did not die immediately after stunning to the total number of hogs stunned expressed in percent (%)

title: conveyor restrainer
meaning: type of hog restrainer that uses conveyor system for moving, restraining, stunning and dumping the animal to the sticking and bleeding area

title: hot wanding
meaning: charging of the electric prods prior to application of stunner

title: knurling
meaning: a series of small ridges or grooves on the surface or edge of the prods to improve contact during application of the electric stunner

title: prod
meaning: tip of the electric stunner to which the revolving spur is attached

title: restrainer
meaning: slaughterhouse equipment used to secure and restrict the body movements of the animal in upright position prior to stunning

title: revolving spurs
meaning: spiked wheel attached to the head-only type electric stunner used to improve contact with the head of the animal to be stunned

title: stunner
meaning: device that is used to make an animal unconscious prior to sticking and bleeding

title: head only type
meaning: Type of electric stunner that allows current to pass through the brain of the hog rendering the animal unconscious

title: head to back type
meaning: Type of electrical stunner in which one of the prods is positioned on the head and the other prod is positioned on the body of the hog

title: head to foreleg type
meaning: Type of electric stunner integrated in the conveyor restrainer wherein the electrodes are made in contact with the forehead and forelegs of the animal

title: bore
meaning: diameter of the piston inside the cylinder

title: breed
meaning: species of hog used as test material

title: bruises
meaning: physical damages or wounds on the skin of the test hog caused by the restraining equipment

title: dumping angle
meaning: optimum angle that the discharge wall can tilt measured from its initial position up to its dumping position

title: dumping position
meaning: position of the discharge wall that allows discharge of stunned hog from the restrainer

title: dumping time
meaning: time it takes the semi-automatic restrainer to tilt the discharge wall

title: girth
meaning: measurement around the hog's body just behind the forelegs that is used to compute for the estimated weight of the hog in the absence of the scale

title: counterweight
meaning: piece of mass that has a weight almost equal to that the of the entrance gate attached at one end of the cable that acts as operating lever of the vertical entrance gate

title: counterweight guide
meaning: keeps the counterweight in its line of motion

title: discharge wall
meaning: part of the restrainer which can be tilted on one side, known as dumping side, to release hog after stunning

title: drop floor
meaning: flooring of the hog restrainer designed to suspend the hog during disengagement

title: drop floor lever
meaning: lever used to reset drop floor

title: dump lever
meaning: opens the dumping side wall of the restrainer to release the hog from the restrainer

title: entrance gate
meaning: opening that allows livestock access into the restrainer

title: false floor
meaning: solid floor at the bottom of the automatic restrainer for the animals to walk down to the entrance ramp

title: floor lock
meaning: keeps the drop floor in its locked position

title: hydraulic cylinder
meaning: mechanical device used to give a linear force through a linear stroke using the energy of the hydraulic fluid under pressure

title: pneumatic cylinder
meaning: mechanical device which produces force, often in combination with movement, and are powered by compressed gas (typically air)

title: stroke
meaning: length of displacement of the cylinder rod which is equivalent to the length of the rod in the cylinder in its extended position less the length once retracted

title: perforation interval
meaning: distance measured from the center of one pipe perforation to the center of the adjacent perforation

title: rib interval
meaning: distance between the ribs of the release cradle

title: release angle
meaning: optimum angle that the release cradle can swing

title: boiler
meaning: vessel to which water, fuel and air are supplied and in which steam is generated

title: release cradle
meaning: part of the scalder that is used to remove hogs from the scalder

title: scalder
meaning: scalding tank; slaughterhouse equipment that can contain water which is heated to loosen the animal's hair from the follicles

title: schedule
meaning: refers to the standard wall thickness of the commercially available pipe which is relative to the applied pressure and material strength

title: solenoid valve
meaning: an electromechanical valve used to automatically shut off or open steam line in hog scalder

title: thermostat
meaning: device used to automatically control and to keep temperature within the required settings

title: steam heated scalder
meaning: Type of hog scalder wherein water is directly heated by using steam which passes through perforated pipes

title: gas heated scalder
meaning: Type of hog scalder wherein water is heated by using a burner

title: solid fired scalder
meaning: Type of hog scalder wherein water is heated by using biomass fuels such as coconut shell, saw dust, firewood and rice hull fed into the furnace to be burned

title: vertical scalder
meaning: Type of hog scalder usually integrated in automated slaughterhouses wherein hogs are scalded while being hung on the overhead railing

title: bracket spacing
meaning: hanger spacing; horizontal distance between rail hangers

title: moving load capacity
meaning: maximum load capacity of a rail track in a 1000 mm distance, expressed in kg

title: radius of curvature
meaning: radius; distance of a circle or curve to its center

title: rail slope
meaning: measurement of upward or downward inclination of the rail track from a reference horizontal plane

title: rail track spacing
meaning: center to center distance or spacing between railings measured horizontally

title: corbel
meaning: horizontal protruding rectangular block from the column of the building that gives support to the main rail frame

title: gambrel
meaning: horizontal supporting bar where carcass is attached through incision in the hind feet

title: hog side
meaning: separate half of the split hog

title: hog trolley frame
meaning: yolk-like flat steel bar where trolley wheel is mounted

title: hoist
meaning: device used for lifting or lowering a load by means of a drum or lift-wheel around which rope or chain wraps

title: overhead rail
meaning: suspended solid steel track used to hang and/or convey carcasses

title: overhead rail frame
meaning: solid horizontal metal beam where rail track is securely fastened

title: rail hanger/bracket
meaning: steel material that supports and holds the rail track suspended from the overhead rail frame

title: rail height
meaning: height of rail measured from top of the rail to the floor

title: rail scale
meaning: electronic weighing device integrated to an overhead rail system

title: rail spacing
meaning: center to center distance or spacing between railings measured horizontally

title: rail switch
meaning: mechanical retracting rail that allows change in direction of trolley

title: rail track
meaning: rail; conveyor track where trolleys are hanged and allowed to roll

title: retained rail
meaning: rail branch where suspected carcass is diverted for further inspection

title: shackle chain
meaning: shackle; solid metal chain used to tie or hold the hog through the feet for lifting

title: suspected carcass
meaning: condition wherein the final judgment of the carcass cannot be ascertained and would therefore require further inspection and/or examination

title: track size/diameter
meaning: specified dimensions of track rail, expressed in millimeters

title: trolley
meaning: suspended metal carrier assembly with one (1) or two (2) wheels and a hook used to carry or transport carcass

title: trolley pin
meaning: a shafting or a spindle that holds the trolley wheel in its frame

title: trolley swivel
meaning: circular steel bar hook attached at the lower end of the trolley that allows rotation of the suspended hogs

title: trolley wheel
meaning: circular pulley-like steel material that rolls freely on the rail

title: bending
meaning: flexural stress; stress caused by bending moment at a given point in the beam supporting the overhead rail system

title: fracture
meaning: deformation caused by excessive stress applied to the overhead rail system

title: sagging
meaning: failure due to elastic instability of the overhead rail system

title: speed reduction
meaning: ratio of the speed of conveyor without load to the speed of conveyor with load, expressed in percent

title: tensile strength
meaning: average normal stress at any point on the cross sectional area of the overhead rail system

title: bleeding
meaning: process of removing the blood from the animal before further handling

title: carcass side
meaning: separate half of the split carcass

title: large ruminants
meaning: whom animal having rumen as part of its stomach such as cattle, carabao and buffalo

title: lowerator
meaning: motorized or hydraulic device that allows gradual descent of carcass along the rail

title: splitting
meaning: cutting or dividing the carcass into half through its backbone

title: spreader
meaning: horizontal supporting bar used for separating the hind legs of hung animal to a distance suitable for evisceration and splitting processes

title: stopper
meaning: auxiliary part of the overhead rail system used to halt the trolley to slide on the rail tracks during operations.

title: suspended carcass
meaning: condition wherein the final judgment of the carcass cannot be ascertained and would therefore require further inspection and/or examination

title: track sale
meaning: electronic weighing device integrated to an overhead rail system

title: track size
meaning: track diameter; specified dimensions of rail track, expressed in millimeters

title: trolley frame
meaning: flat bar of non-corrosive materials that holds the trolley wheel, swivel and hook together

title: trolley hook
meaning: round stainless steel bar shaped into hook where the carcass is hung

title: bearing stress
meaning: force per unit area in contact like compressive and tensile stress

title: compressive stress
meaning: force per unit area, that tends to compress or shorten the material

title: leveling bubble
meaning: instrument used for checking whether a plane structure is flat and horizontally leveled

title: splitting type
meaning: time required to split one (1) carcass expressed in seconds

title: floor plate
meaning: part of the platform that serves as the flooring for the operator to stand on

title: floor plate height
meaning: distance measured vertically from the floor plate to the finish floor line

title: guard rail
meaning: part of the platform designed to provide safety for the operator

title: hand rail
meaning: part of the guard rail designed to be grasped by the operator when ascending, descending or moving horizontally

title: platform
meaning: equipment used by the operator to reach the required height to perform slaughtering process

title: platform control
meaning: switch; auxiliary part of the mechanical platform that regulates the speed and controls the vertical ' horizontal movement of the platform

title: side travel
meaning: sideward or horizontal movement of the platform

title: stationary platform
meaning: Type of platform that has a fixed height for a specific application such as bleeding, dehiding, evisceration and splitting

title: blade speed
meaning: linear displacement of the blade's teeth per unit time, expressed in millimeter per second

title: bone dust
meaning: particles of bone accumulated during cutting

title: cutting depth
meaning: depth of cut by the splitting saw through the backbone, expressed in millimeter

title: cutting speed
meaning: speed of cutting through the backbone, expressed in seconds

title: dimension
meaning: the physical measurement of an object as described by its length, width, height and thickness

title: percent splitting efficiency
meaning: amount of energy delivered by the splitting saw relative to the total energy input, expressed in percent

title: splitting rate
meaning: number of hogs split per unit time, expressed in heads per hour

title: splitting time
meaning: actual time of splitting a single hog, expressed in seconds

title: backbone
meaning: vertebral column of an animal

title: blade guard
meaning: safety cover for cutting mechanism

title: blade holders
meaning: holding mechanism for hand saw that tightens and keeps the blade in a vertical position

title: blade teeth
meaning: small sharp points along the cutting side of the saw

title: cutting blade
meaning: blade of a saw with a small, sharp metal teeth along the cutting edge

title: drive shaft
meaning: mechanism that delivers rotating motion from the motor to the cutting blade

title: gripping handle
meaning: part of the machine that provides friction against the hand, reducing the gripping force needed to achieve a reliable grip

title: gullets
meaning: spaces between each segment of the blade to provide cooling and slurry removal

title: hanger mounting bracket
meaning: part of the saw used for suspending the entire machine, such that the hanger mounting bracket is located at the center of gravity of the machine

title: main frame
meaning: body of the splitting saw

title: rotary saw
meaning: circular saw; machine with rotating circular blade used for cutting material

title: splitting saw
meaning: tool with a metal blade designed to cut the backbone of hog carcass

title: tooth pitch
meaning: spacing between the blade teeth, expressed in teeth per inch

title: linear speed
meaning: linear displacement of the rotating blade at a given time, expressed in meter per second

title: rotating time
meaning: total time spent to rotate the restraint from its upright position to inverted position

title: rotating angle
meaning: angle measured from the restraint's initial upright position to inverted position

title: chin lift
meaning: part of the head gate which positions the head of the animal to facilitate stunning

title: discharge gate
meaning: part of the stunning box which opens to release the animal after stunning

title: head gate
meaning: part of the stunning box which secures the head in restraining the animal

title: tail pusher
meaning: part of the stunning box which pushes the animal forward towards the head gate

title: upright type
meaning: Type of stunning box that resembles a small cage with open top and has a side gate for removal of stunned animal

title: rotating type
meaning: Type of stunning box that has adjustable side walls and back rest that supports the body of the animal during flipping

title: biogas plant
meaning: plant used to process animal wastes or manure to produce biogas and sludge consisting of an inlet/mixing tank, digester, gas chamber and outlet/sludge tank

title: integrated plant
meaning: biogas plant where the digester and gas chamber form one unit

title: split type plant
meaning: digester and gas chamber form separate units

title: multi digester
meaning: plant with series of digesters

title: floating type
meaning: plant consisting of digester and a moving, floating gasholder that either float directly in the fermenting slurry or in a separate water jacket

title: fixed type
meaning: closed digester with an immovable, rigid gas chamber and a displacement pit

title: balloon type
meaning: plant consisting of a heat-sealed plastic or rubber bag (balloon), combining digester and gasholder

title: collecting tank
meaning: holding tank; chamber where manure and water are collected, stored and separated from heavy and nonbiodegradable materials before feeding them into the digester

title: inlet pipe
meaning: serves as conveyor of the manure-water mixture or slurry from the mixing tank to the digester

title: digester
meaning:
any water and air tight container designed for the process of anaerobic microbiological degradation of organic matter into which the slurry is introduced for digestion and
methanization

title: baffle board
meaning: division in the digester that prevent the slurry from premature exit into the sludge/outlet tank

title: stirrer
meaning: agitator; mechanical device inside the digester used to stir the slurry

title: gas chamber
meaning: space inside or outside the digester for the collection and storage of biogas

title: gas holder retainer
meaning: cantilever beam that holds the gasholder/movable cover in position at the desired biogas pressure

title: outlet pipe
meaning: serves as conveyor where the effluent or the slurry is forced out

title: backfill
meaning: layer of compacted soil and gravel to support the digester wall

title: loading rate
meaning: amount of slurry fed per unit volume of digester capacity per day

title: substrate
meaning: organic material used to produce biogas

title: seeding
meaning: adding or introducing anaerobic bacteria to the digester

title: slurry
meaning: mixture of manure and water

title: freeboard
meaning: difference in height between the digester wall and the filling line

title: filling line
meaning: level of slurry when the digesters is at full load

title: retention time
meaning: average period that a given quantity of slurry is retained in the digester for digestion

title: toxic materials
meaning: materials that inhibit the normal growth of pathogens in the digester such as mineral ions, heavy metals and detergents

title: methanization
meaning: various processes that take place among the methanogens, non-methanogens and substrates fed into the digester as inputs

title: methanogens
meaning: anaerobic bacteria that act upon organic materials and in the process, produce biogas

title: mesophilic temperature range
meaning: temperature range of 20 oC ' 40 oC where mesophilic bacteria operates

title: gas production rate
meaning: amount of biogas produced per day per cubic meter of slurry

title: biogas
meaning: mixture of gas (composed of 50 to 70 percent methane and 30 to 40 percent carbon dioxide) produced by methanogenic bacteria

title: scum
meaning: layer of floating material (mainly fibrous) on the slurry

title: sludge
meaning: settled portion or precipitate of the slurry; a mud-like, semi-solid mass

title: effluent
meaning: residue that comes out at the outlet after the substrate is digested/processed inside the digester

title: feedlot
meaning: area with its physical facilities used for carabao fattening

title: carabao
meaning: Philippine water buffalo or swamp buffalo

title: bull
meaning: breeding male of any age

title: calf
meaning: young male or female under one year of age

title: cow
meaning: mature female that has already calved

title: heifer
meaning: female between two to three years of age which has not given birth

title: corral
meaning: enclosure for confining and handling livestock

title: holding pen
meaning: pen for confining animals from the pasture

title: crowding pen
meaning: pen used to funnel cattle into the working chute

title: working chute
meaning: chute leading the cattle from the crowding pen to the holding chute/squeeze

title: holding chute
meaning: use to restrain animals

title: loading chute
meaning: chute used to load cattle from working chute or crowding pen to a vehicle

title: workshop
meaning: building for fabrication, repair and maintenance of tools, implements, equipments and parts of structures and provides a place where tools, supplies and spare parts are stored

title: machinery shed
meaning: area to protect machinery from weather, theft, vandalism and to allow easy maintenance and adjustment of machines

title: hazardous material
meaning: substances on farms that are highly flammable or poisonous

title: controlled atmosphere storage
meaning: storage in an artificial atmosphere in which the proportion of carbon dioxide and/or oxygen is precisely controlled

title: bulk storage
meaning: produce is piled in room-sized bins, which exerts forces that must be resisted by the building walls

title: pallet bin storage
meaning: produce is placed in boxes or pallet bins which in turn are stacked in storage room

title: pallet
meaning: low portable platform made of wood or metal or plastic or in combination to facilitate handling, storage, or transport of materials as a unit load using a forklift

title: drip cooler
meaning: storage structure with continuously wetted walls

title: burlap
meaning: coarse cloth made of jute, flax or hemp

title: air cooled
meaning: storage provided with good ventilation

title: vapor barrier
meaning: materials used to prevent migration of moisture into a storage area

title: cell pack
meaning: individual divisions in a carton formed by fiberboard dividers, each cell to contain one fruit

title: telescopic cartons
meaning: cartons in which the cover is separate and fits snugly over the bottom part

title: greenhouse
meaning: structure that provide a reliable enclosure within which an environment favorable to plant growth can be attained

title: ridge and furrow greenhouse
meaning: method of greenhouse construction where modular roof units are connected at the eave by a common gutter

title: cooling
meaning: removal of heat from the interior of the greenhouse

title: heating
meaning: addition of heat to the interior of the greenhouse from any energy source including the sun

title: shading
meaning: prevents excess solar radiation in the greenhouse

title: ventilation
meaning: process of exchanging air inside the greenhouse with outside air to control temperature, humidity, oxygen or carbon dioxide levels

title: mechanical ventilation
meaning: ventilation of greenhouse using fans

title: natural ventilation
meaning: ventilation of greenhouse which occurs through controlled openings due to natural pressure variations inside and outside the greenhouse

title: brooder guard
meaning: materials that are placed around the brooder stoves to prevent the chicks from straying too far away from the heat supply until they learn the source of heat

title: brooding
meaning: process of supplying heat to the chicks after hatching up to the time that their natural heat regulatory mechanisms becomes fully functional

title: litter
meaning: material used as bedding for animals

title: open sided housing
meaning: long and narrow type of houses wherein at least one-half of the front and the back of the house are open

title: enclosed housing
meaning: house wherein inside conditions are maintained as near as possible to the bird's optimum requirements with the use of mechanical ventilation and artificial lighting

title: loose housing
meaning: A type of housing where animals are free to move between resting, feeding and watering areas

title: yearling
meaning: one to two year old cattle of either sex

title: parturition
meaning: act of giving birth except for swine

title: buck
meaning: mature male goat

title: doe
meaning: mature female goat that has kidded

title: dry doe
meaning: doe without milk

title: kid
meaning: young goat under six months old of either sex

title: ewe
meaning: mature female sheep that has already lambed

title: lamb
meaning: sheep under six months of age

title: ram
meaning: mature male sheep

title: litter type
meaning: type of flooring utilizing the most commonly available materials such as rice hull and rice straw and wood shavings over the cemented floor

title: slotted type
meaning: type of flooring with openings to facilitate cleaning of the droppings

title: slotted litter type
meaning: combination of slotted and litter type flooring wherein slats cover 60% of the total floor area and 40% is covered with litter.

title: community nest
meaning: large nesting boxes for 3 - 6 layers

title: boar
meaning: refers to a male breeding swine which is at least 8 months old

title: creep area
meaning: place for piglets inside the farrowing pen

title: culling rate
meaning: rate of removing undesirable or unproductive animals within the herd

title: dry sows
meaning: unbred sows which have just been weaned; non-pregnant sows

title: farrowing
meaning: act of giving birth in swine

title: farrowing pen
meaning: area in which a sow is confined during farrowing and lactation periods, but in which the sow can turn around

title: farrowing stall
meaning: device in which a sow is confined during farrowing and lactation periods and which prevents sow from turning around

title: fattener
meaning: swine raised for meat production usually starts at 15 kg

title: finisher
meaning: swine which are 66 kg and up

title: gilt
meaning: female swine that has not farrowed

title: grower
meaning: swine from 40 to 65 kg

title: litter
meaning: piglets born in one farrowing

title: litter index
meaning: average number of farrowings of one sow per year

title: occupancy
meaning: number of days an animal stays in a pen

title: sow
meaning: any breeding female pig that has farrowed

title: weaner
meaning: piglet that has been recently separated from its mother

title: lairage
meaning: any premise or yard used for the confinement of animals awaiting to be slaughtered which include unloading ramp, pens and detention pens

title: small animals
meaning: refers to sheep, goat, and deer

title: large animals
meaning: refers to cattle and carabao

title: detention pen
meaning: separate compartment in the lairage used to confine sick or suspected animals

title: loose type
meaning: animals are free to move in a pen while awaiting to be slaughtered

title: tie up type
meaning: pugnacious animals are tied within the pen while awaiting to be slaughtered

title: slaughterhouse
meaning: any building or place used for killing of animals where the flesh is intended for human consumption

title: milking parlor
meaning: building or a portion of building where milking occurs but where no animals are housed

title: holding area
meaning: area provided to accommodate animals before milking

title: back out stall
meaning: type of stall where animals must back up to exit the stall

title: walk through
meaning: type of stalls that allows the animals to proceed directly forward after milking is completed

title: tissue culture
meaning: growth of protoplasts, cells, tissues, shoot tips, roots, anthers, embryos, flowers and meristems in a laboratory medium

title: culture medium
meaning: any nutrient material prepared for the growth and cultivation plant tissue

title: sterilization
meaning: process of making any material entirely free from living microorganism

title: asepsis
meaning: condition that describes the freedom of plant materials, culture medium, confines of the culture vessel from contaminating microorganisms

title: incubation
meaning: subjecting of cultures to conditions favorable to the growth of the plant tissue

title: laminar flow
meaning: flow air currents in which air currents do not intermingle

title: carcass
meaning: body of dressed birds

title: dressing
meaning: process composed of bleeding, defeathering, eviscerating, and from which the head, shanks, crop, oil gland and other inedible parts are removed

title: offal
meaning: by-products, organs, glands and tissue other than meat of the food animal

title: evisceration
meaning: process of removing the internal organs in the abdominal and thoracic cavities

title: shackling
meaning: process of restraining birds prior to slitting

title: trench drain
meaning: trough that collects the waste from a larger area and directs the flow to a drain opening

title: primary processing
meaning: product handling which include steps to make a harvested commodity more suitable for manufacturers or consumers

title: grading
meaning: process of classifying into groups according to a set of recognized criteria of quality and size, each group bearing an accepted name and size grouping

title: sizing
meaning: process of classifying into sizes according to criteria that may or may not be recognized or accepted by the industry

title: sorting
meaning: Process of classifying into groups designated by the person classifying the produce either according to a set of criteria or whatever criteria he may set

title: air change ratio
meaning: ratio of the volume of air that enters a room to the volume of air of the empty room

title: inspection
meaning: process of determining whether the grade standards have been interpreted or enforced properly by inspecting random samples usually of predetermined amount large enough to give an indication of the correctness of the grading procedure

title: packaging
meaning: process to ensure adequate protection and safe delivery of a product from the producer to the ultimate consumer

title: stunning pen
meaning: compartment which is suitable for confining only one animal at a time while it is being stunned and which is so constructed as to confine, without discomfort, to prevent any substantial movement of the animal forward, backward or sideway

title: stunning
meaning: renders an animal insensible before it is killed

title: pithing
meaning: insertion of a rod or coiled wire through the hole in the skull of cattle made by the captive blot to destroy the brain and spinal cord to prevent reflex muscular action and possible injury to operatives

title: sticking
meaning: severance of the major blood vessels in the neck or immediately anterior to the heart by means of a knife and 'stuck' shall be construed accordingly.

title: bleeding
meaning: remove as much blood from the carcass as possible before further handling

title: scalding
meaning: lowering of animal into steam to prepare skin for dehairing

title: dehairing
meaning: removal of the hair of the carcass

title: gambrelling
meaning: suspending the carcass for particular operation

title: singeing
meaning: cleaning the carcass by burning the hair

title: dressing
meaning: preparation of carcass after evisceration, ready for storage or sale

title: splittng
meaning: dividing carcass into parts

title: carcass
meaning: all parts including viscera of slaughtered cattle, sheep, goats or swine that may be used for human consumption

title: meat
meaning: edible part of the muscle of cattle, sheep, goats or swine

title: green offal
meaning: digestive tract of ruminants such as the stomach, or the intestines which still contain fecal matter

title: black offal
meaning: digestive tract of swine such as the stomach, or the intestines which still contain fecal matter

title: detained meat
meaning: meat requiring further examination as declared by a veterinary inspector after veterinary examination

title: condemned meat
meaning: meat which is unfit for human consumption as declared by a veterinary inspector after veterinary examination

title: gut and tripe
meaning: black or green offal

title: warehouse
meaning: building used for storing paddy or rice and other grains in bags

title: bag storage
meaning: storing of paddy or corn kernels in bags usually made of jute (gunny) or polyethylene and normally accommodates 44-50 kilos

title: palay
meaning: paddy; rough rice; unhulled grain of Oryza sativa L., that is grain with the hull/husk enclosing the grain

title: fumigation
meaning: process of using chemicals to control insects in grains in a form of fumes

title: moisture content
meaning: amount of moisture in the grain expressed as percentage of the total weight of the sample, wet basis

title: dunnage
meaning: pallet; wooden frames used on concrete floors for stacking bags to prevent direct contact between the grains and the floor

title: aeration
meaning: moving of air through stored grains at low airflow rates (generally between 0.07 ' 0.28 cubic meter per minute per ton) for purposes other than drying, to maintain or improve its quality

title: aerobic
meaning: requires free oxygen

title: agricultural liquid waste
meaning: consist of liquid waste and slurry resulting from the production of livestock and poultry; and processing of crops, livestock and poultry

title: anaerobic
meaning: presence of free oxygen is not required

title: clean runoff
meaning: runoff not contaminated with manure such as runoff from roofs, grassed areas, drives and other areas which are not animal alleys

title: disinfection
meaning: process of killing all pathogenic microorganisms

title: dissolved solids
meaning: part of total solids passing through the filter in a filtration procedure

title: effluent
meaning: liquid waste, partially or completely treated, flowing out of a reservoir, basin, or wastewater treatment plant

title: facultative lagoons
meaning: lagoons that can function as aerobic or anaerobic depending on the environment

title: fixed solids
meaning: part of total solids remaining after volatile gases driven off at 600oC

title: grit
meaning: non-biodegradable component of liquid waste composed of sand, gravel, cinders or other heavy solid materials

title: holding pond
meaning: storage where liquid waste is stored before final disposal

title: influent
meaning: liquid that flows into a containing space

title: lagoon
meaning: pit in the ground where liquid waste is stored to produce a higher quality effluent

title: liners
meaning: system of clay layers and/or geosynthetic membranes used to contain leachate and reduce or prevent contaminant flow to groundwater

title: lot runoff
meaning: rainfall containing animal manure

title: manure
meaning: accumulated moist animal excrement that does not undergo decomposition or drying; it include feces and urine which may be mixed with bedding material, spilled feed or soil

title: pathogenic microorganism
meaning: microorganism capable of causing diseases

title: primary treatment
meaning: treatment that causes substances in liquid waste to readily settle or float

title: secondary treatment
meaning: treatment used to convert dissolved or suspended materials into a form more readily separated from the liquid waste being treated

title: sludge
meaning: precipitate resulting from coagulation or sedimentation of liquid waste

title: slurry
meaning: watery mixture of insoluble solid

title: suspended solids
meaning: solids removed by filtration

title: total solids
meaning: residue remaining after water is removed from waste material by evaporation

title: volatile solid
meaning: part of total solids driven off as volatile gases when heated to 600oC

title: agricultural solid waste
meaning: wastes resulting from the production and processing of crops and animals or agricultural products, including manures with at least 20% solids, pruning and crop residues wherever produced

title: bulking agent
meaning: any item used to improve the compost structure and to increase porosity to allow internal air movement

title: c:n ratio
meaning: weight ratio of carbon to nitrogen

title: compost mix
meaning: mixture of an organic waste with amendment(s) or bulking agent(s) in the proper proportions to promote aerobic microbial activity and growth and to achieve optimum temperatures

title: composting
meaning: controlled decomposition of organic matter by micro-organisms, mainly bacteria and fungi, into a humus-like product

title: composting amendment
meaning: any item added to the compost mixture that alters the moisture content, C:N ratio, or pH

title: curing
meaning: process where fungi digest the carbons not degraded during composting and further stabilize the nutrients

title: disposal site
meaning: site where solid waste is finally discharged and deposited

title: leachate
meaning: shall refer to the liquid produced when waste undergo decomposition, and when water percolate through solid waste undergoing decomposition; contaminated liquid that contains dissolved and suspended materials

title: storage
meaning: interim containment of solid waste after generation and prior to collection for ultimate recovery or disposal

title: windrow composting
meaning: involves the arrangement of compost mix in long, narrow piles or windrows that are periodically turned to maintain aerobic conditions

title: aggregates
meaning: granular material of mineral composition such as sand, gravel, shell, crushed and uncrushed stone or light weight materials

title: backfill
meaning: the suitable material used to replace other materials removed during construction

title: base course
meaning: the layer of aggregate, soil-treated aggregate, treated soil, or soil aggregate that rests upon the Subbase or if no Subbase, upon the sub-grade.

title: borrow
meaning: the suitable material used for embankments

title: clearing
meaning: removal and disposal of trees, vegetation or other unwanted materials from the ground surface

title: bridge
meaning: structure, including supports, erected over a depression or an obstruction, such as water, a highway, or a railway; having a roadway or track for carrying traffic or other moving loads

title: compaction
meaning: application of pressure to aggregates to result in a dense mass free of excessive voids.

title: course
meaning: structural component of specified thickness. It may consist of one layer or more

title: culvert
meaning: drainage structure that may or may not, directly support and that extends across and beneath a highway street, driveway, alley, arterial, or other public way

title: crushed gravel
meaning: product resulting from the mechanical crushing of gravel, with substantially all fragments having at least one face resulting from fracture

title: drainage
meaning: removal of water from the road area by the use of culverts, ditches, channels and other several structures

title: earthwork
meaning: operations connected with excavating and placing embankments with soil, earth or rock

title: erosion control
meaning: protection of soil from disclosing by water, wind, or other agent

title: excavation
meaning: act of cutting, digging, or scooping to remove material

title: field density test
meaning: determination of the degree of compactness of the soil

title: fill
meaning: the embankment material placed above natural ground line

title: farm to market roads
meaning: access roads that connect major road arteries to the agricultural production areas where farm produce are being mobilized and transported to the market by the farmers and fishermen

title: grade
meaning: slope of a roadway, channel, or natural ground

title: gradation
meaning: property of a soil which describes the distribution of size groups

title: gradient
meaning: rate of increase or decrease in the level of the land, the slope expressed in percentage

title: grading
meaning: preparation of the sub-grade, in line and elevation, for application of pavement materials including base and surfacing materials

title: grubbing
meaning: removal and disposal of trees, and other unwanted materials below the ground surface

title: lane roadway
meaning: roadway, which is divided into two (2) or more clearly marked lanes for vehicular traffic

title: masonry
meaning: form of stone, brick, concrete block, concrete, or other similar building materials that have been bonded together with mortar to form a structure

title: one lane earth road
meaning: earth roadway, which one way is a clearly marked lane for vehicular traffic

title: one lane gravel road
meaning: gravel roadway, which one way is clearly marked lane for vehicular traffic

title: one lane asphalt pavement road
meaning: asphalt pavement roadway, which one way is clearly marked lane for vehicular traffic

title: one lane concrete road
meaning: concrete roadway, which one way is clearly marked lane for vehicular traffic

title: riprap
meaning: quarried stone especially selected, graded and placed to prevent erosion and thereby preserve the shape of a surface, slope, or underlying structure

title: road bed
meaning: graded portion of a highway between top and side slopes, prepared as a foundation for the pavement structure and shoulder

title: roadway
meaning: space/location/site intended to employ traffic consideration for the transport of agricultural products

title: road carriageway
meaning: travel way or crown portion of the roadway intended for the movement of vehicles, exclusive of shoulders

title: road carriageway width
meaning: lateral design width for one lane or two lanes strip of roadway

title: roadway embankment
meaning: raised structure of soil, soil aggregate, sand or rock

title: road shoulder
meaning: part of the roadway next to the traveled way or auxiliary lanes that provide lateral support of base and surface courses and is an emergency stopping area for vehicles

title: salvage materials
meaning: saving of different existing materials from the projects which are removed and intended to be used in other construction

title: specifications
meaning: written technical description of materials, equipment, construction systems, standards, and workmanship that, in conjunction with the drawings, detail the requirements for acceptable completion of the work

title: structures
meaning: refer to the bridges, culverts, wall, buildings, foundations, water tanks, transmission towers, cribbing, caissons or coffer dams, other similar features which may be encountered in the work and are classified as structures

title: subbase course
meaning: refers to the layer of the specified or selected materials of designated thickness in a pavement structure immediately above the sub-grade and below the base course

title: traffic
meaning: vehicular and non-vehicular movement along a route such as pedestrians, vehicles, animals, etc.

title: turn out section
meaning: a widened, unobstructed shoulder area, about 30 meters long, that may be used for emergency purposes or allow slow-moving vehicles to pull out of the carriageway to give passing opportunity to following or incoming vehicles

title: earth road
meaning: roadbed upon which the pavement structures is placed (subgrade)

title: gravel road
meaning: upper portion of material which act as foundation Subbase course (subgrade)

title: two lane concrete pavement road
meaning: concrete pavement roadway, on which two lanes are marked for vehicular traffic

title: bituminous, concrete road
meaning: top surface of the roadbed upon which the pavement is placed (subgrade)

title: two lane earth road
meaning: earth roadway, which two(2) ways are marked lanes for vehicular traffic

title: two lane gravel road
meaning: gravel roadway, which two (2) ways are marked lanes for vehicular traffic

title: two lane asphalt pavement road
meaning: asphalt pavement roadway, which two ways are marked lanes for vehicular traffic

title: radial load
meaning: load or force passing through the axis of rotation

title: rated life
meaning: the number of revolutions or hours at a given constant speed that 90 percent of an apparently identical group of bearings will complete or exceed before the first evidence of fatigue develops

title: basic dynamic load rating
meaning: the radial load that a ball bearing can withstand for one million revolutions of the inner ring

title: equivalent dynamic load
meaning: constant stationary radial load which, if applied to a bearing with rotating inner ring and stationary outer ring, would give the same life as that which the bearing will attain under the actual conditions of load and rotation

title: basic static load rating
meaning: the maximum radial load, which corresponds to a calculated contact stress at the center of the most heavily, loaded rolling element/raceway contact

title: equivalent static load
meaning: static radial load, if applied, which produces a maximum contact stress equal in magnitude to the maximum contact stress in the actual condition of loading

title: fastener
meaning: a mechanical device designed specifically to hold, join, or maintain equilibrium of single or multiple components

title: bolt
meaning: an externally threaded fastener designed for insertion through holes in assembled parts, and normally tightened or released by torquing a nut

title: nut
meaning: a block or sleeve having an internal thread designed to assemble with the external thread on a bolt, screw, stud or other threaded part

title: nominal size
meaning: the designation used for the purpose of general identification

title: length of fastener
meaning: the distance from the intersection of the largest diameter of the head with the bearing surface to the extreme end of the fastener, measured parallel to the axis of the fastener

title: right hand thread
meaning: thread which winds in a clockwise and receding direction from the starting end, when viewed from that end

title: left hand thread
meaning: a thread which winds in a counterclockwise and receding direction from the starting end, when viewed from that end

title: proof load
meaning: the specified load which the fastener must withstand without any indication of permanent deformation after the load is released

title: pitch
meaning: the distance (in millimeters), measured parallel to the thread axis, between corresponding points on adjacent thread forms in the same axial plane on the same side of the axis

title: major diamater
meaning: for a straight thread, this is the diameter of the imaginary cylinder bounding the crest of an external thread or the root of an internal thread

title: minor diameter
meaning: for a straight thread, this diameter is the imaginary cylinder bounding the root of an external thread or the crest of an internal thread

title: pitch diameter
meaning:
for a straight thread, this is the diameter of the imaginary cylinder whose surface passes through the thread profiles in such a way to make the widths of the thread ridge and the
thread groove equal

title: couplings
meaning: used to join lengths of shafting, which must often be sectionalized for practicability and economy in manufacture and shipping or for purposes of ready installation

title: clutches
meaning: couplings which permits the disengagement of the coupled shafts during rotation.

title: splines
meaning: used for the transmission of power from a shaft to hub or vice versa.

title: friction clutch
meaning: designed to reduce coupling shack by slipping during the engagement period. They also serve as safety devices by slipping when the torque exceeds their maximum rating.

title: centrifugal clutch
meaning: produces its torque by virtue of the centrifugal force of weights pressing against the driving or frictionally driven member.

title: conical friction clutch
meaning: consists of a frustum of a cone, so fitted to a shaft by means of a feather key that it can be pushed into an opposite engaging surface rigidly attached to the other shaft.

title: positive clutch
meaning: designed to transmit torque without slip, jaw clutches are the most common

title: rigid coupling
meaning: used when the shafts are virtually collinear and when they remain in a fixed angular relation with respect to each other (except for angular deflection).

title: clamp shaft coupling
meaning: essentially a split and bolted sleeve coupling, proportioned to clamp firmly on the shafts

title: flange face coupling
meaning: commonly used in permanent installations for heavy loads and large sizes and particularly for vertical drives, as agitators

title: flexible coupling
meaning: designed to connect shafts which are misaligned either laterally or angularly. A secondary benefit is the absorption of impacts due to fluctuations in shaft torque or angular speed.

title: universal joint
meaning: used to connect shafts with much larger values of misalignment than can be tolerated by the other types of flexible couplings

title: involute splines
meaning: multiple keys in the general form of internal and external gear teeth, used to prevent relative rotation of cylindrically fitted machine parts

title: square splines
meaning: are employed in multiple-spline fittings having 4, 6, 10, or 16 splines

title: plastics
meaning: synthetic organic material, including cellulose derivatives, with or without the incorporation of fillers, binders, pigments, dyes, which is capable of being shaped

title: monomer
meaning: simple unpolymerized form of chemical compound

title: polymer
meaning: chemical compound with higher molecular weight consisting of a number of structural units linked together by covalent bonds

title: copolymer
meaning: polymers consisting of more than one monomer

title: covalent
meaning: non-ionic chemical bond formed by stored electrons

title: thermoplastic
meaning: substances that melt on heating and are processes in this state by a variety of extrusion and molding process

title: thermoset
meaning: substances that cannot be melted and remelted

title: service temperature
meaning: temperature at which the plastic can withstand without incurring a change in its physical properties

title: flat belt
meaning: belts used to transmit rotary motion and power between two shafts, which lie flat on the face of its corresponding pulley

title: flat belt pulley
meaning: wheel having flat or crowned face used to transmit motion and power by means of flat belts

title: flat belt drive
meaning: power transmission device used to transmit power and motion between two shafts consisting of flat belts which ride in flat pulleys

title: pulley diameter
meaning: outside diameter of the pulley

title: belt length
meaning: stretched-out length of the belt

title: speed ratio
meaning: ratio of the angular velocities of the pulleys making no allowance for slip and creep

title: belt speed
meaning: the linear speed of the belt calculated by multiplying the rpm and the diameter of the driver pulley and to the value of pi

title: helical gear
meaning: cylindrical gear whose tooth traces are helices, it transmits rotational motion and power between two parallel axes

title: gear tooth
meaning: each of the projecting parts of a gear which is intended to ensure, by contact with the teeth of another gear, that one gear turns the other

title: module
meaning: quotient of the circular pitch, expressed in millimeters, to the number ? (or the quotient of the diametral pitch, expressed in millimeters, to the number of teeth)

title: normal module
meaning: quotient of the normal circular pitch (expressed in millimeters)and the number ?, where the normal circular pitch is the product of the circular pitch and the cosine of the helix angle

title: pitch circle
meaning: line of intersection of the pitch cylinder by a plane perpendicular to the axis of the gear

title: addendum
meaning: radial distance between the addendum circle and the pitch circle

title: addendum circle
meaning: circle that bounds the outer ends of the teeth

title: dedendum
meaning: radial distance between the dedendum circle and the pitch circle

title: dedendum circle
meaning: line of intersection of the dedendum cylinder by a plane perpendicular to the axis of the gear

title: clearance
meaning: amount by which the dedendum in a given gear exceeds the addendum of its meshing gear

title: pitch diameter
meaning: diameter of the pitch circle*

title: addendum diameter
meaning: diameter of the addendum circle

title: dedendum diameter
meaning: diameter of the of the dedendum circle

title: tooth depth
meaning: radial distance between the addendum circle and the dedendum circle

title: circular pitch
meaning: length of the arc of the pitch circle between two consecutive corresponding points of adjacent teeth

title: normal circular pitch
meaning: length of the arc, living between the tooth traces of two consecutive corresponding flanks of a cylindrical normal helix

title: tooth thickness
meaning: width of the tooth measured along the circular pitch

title: tooth space
meaning: space between teeth measured along the pitch circle

title: backlash
meaning: difference between the tooth space and the tooth thickness

title: face width
meaning: width over the toothed part of a gear, measured along a straight line generator of the reference cylinder

title: tooth flank
meaning: portion of the surface of a tooth lying between the tip surface and the root surface

title: pressure angle
meaning: pressure angle at the point where the profile cuts the pitch circle

title: normal pressure angle
meaning: pressure angle at a point on a tooth trace

title: helix
meaning: curve whose tangents are inclined at a constant angle to the axis of the cylinder

title: normal helix
meaning: in a cylinder on which helix is considered, a helix which is perpendicular to that helix

title: helix angle
meaning: acute angle between the tooth trace and the generator of any imaginary cylinder or cone coaxial with a gear whose tooth trace is under consideration

title: tooth profile
meaning: the line of intersection of a tooth flank with any defined surface cutting the reference surface

title: tooth trace
meaning: the line of intersection of a flank with the reference surface

title: involute cylindrical gear
meaning: a cylindrical gear of which every usable tooth profile is an arc of an involute to a circle

title: involute to a circle
meaning: plane curve described by a point on a straight line (the "generating line"), which rolls out without slip on the base circle

title: journal bearing
meaning: sleeve bearing; a cylinder which surrounds the shaft and is filled with some form of fluid lubricant

title: journal
meaning: the part of the rotating shaft , axle, roll or spindle that turns in a bearing

title: lubricant
meaning: a medium that supports the shaft preventing metal to metal contact

title: parallel keys
meaning: keys whose longitudinal sides are parallel with each other

title: taper keys
meaning: keys with a tapered longitudinal section

title: woodruff keys
meaning: keys with a semi-circular cross-section

title: bar
meaning: long evenly shaped piece of solid metal

title: deformed bar
meaning: steel bar with lugs or protrusions called deformations

title: nominal diameter of deformed bar
meaning: diameter equivalent to the diameter of a plain round bar having the same mass per meter

title: pipe
meaning: long hollow cylinder of specified thickness whose nominal size is approximated by the inside diameter

title: tube
meaning: long hollow product of round or any other cross-section whose size is specified by the outside dimensions

title: aluminum and aluminum alloy sheet
meaning: rolled rectangular section of thickness over 0.15 mm up to 6.0 mm, with sheared, slit or sawn edges

title: galvanized steel sheet
meaning:
galvanized flat or corrugated metal product cut to the standard or specified length and has a
nominal base metal thickness ranging from 0.20 mm to 1.6 mm and a flat width of 760 mm to 1,220 mm

title: proof stress
meaning: quotient of the load (when the specified permanent elongation occurs in a tensile test) divided by the original cross-sectional area

title: ageing
meaning: term applied to changes in physical and mechanical properties of low carbon steel that occur with the passage of time and adversely affect formability

title: deoxidation
meaning: removal of oxygen which causes oxidation of steel

title: rivet
meaning:
a headed pin of metal used for uniting two or more pieces by passing the shank through a hole in each piece and then by beating or pressing down the plain end so as to make a
second head

title: nominal diameter
meaning: the diameter of the shank

title: lap joint
meaning: a type of riveted joint wherein the plates overlap each other and are held together by one or more rows of rivets.

title: butt joint
meaning: a type of riveted joint wherein the plates being joined are in the same plane and are joined by means of a cover plate or butt strap which is riveted to both plates by one or more rows of rivets

title: pitch
meaning: spacing between rivet centers

title: margin
meaning: the distance from the edge of the plate to the centerline of the nearest row of rivets

title: clinch allowance
meaning: allowance in length of rivet in order to turn over or flatten the protruding end

title: chain pitch
meaning: distance between adjacent joint members

title: bottom diameter
meaning: the diameter of a circle tangent to the curve (called the seating curve) at the bottom of the tooth gap

title: caliper diameter
meaning: for a sprocket with an odd number of teeth, it is the distance from the bottom of the tooth gap to that of the nearest opposite tooth gap

title: outside diameter
meaning: it is the diameter over the tips of the teeth

title: screw
meaning: an externally threaded fastener capable of being inserted into holes in assembled parts, of mating with preformed internal thread or forming its own thread, and of being tightened or released by torquing the head

title: hexagonal flange head
meaning: Used to increase the bearing area thus distributing the fastener load over a large area, particularly on soft materials such as aluminum.

title: pan head
meaning: For applications where space is restricted making impossible to use a wrench for tightening.

title: flat countersunk head
meaning: When space is restricted making impossible to use a wrench for tightening, and where a flat surface is required.

title: oval countersunk head
meaning: When space is restricted making impossible to use a wrench for tightening, where a flat surface is required. This type shall be recommended for machine parts that are always disassembled.

title: slotted head
meaning: When space is restricted making impossible to use a wrench for tightening and for applications that requires no protruding parts of the machine.

title: hexagon socket head
meaning: For applications that require no protruding parts of the machine. The use of this type of setscrew allows easy assembly and disassembly of machine parts

title: spur gear
meaning: a cylindrical gear whose tooth traces are straight lines parallel to the axis. Generally, it transmits rotational motion and power between two axes

title: gear tooth
meaning: each of the projecting parts of a gear which are intended to ensure, by contact with the teeth of another gear, that one of the other gear turns the other

title: bevel gear
meaning: used to transmit power between shafts at practically any angle

title: straight bevel gears
meaning: bevel gears whose teeth are straight but the sides are tapered so that they would intersect the axis at a common point called the pitch cone apex if extended inward

title: miter gears
meaning: bevel gears having equal numbers of driver and driven gear teeth and operate at axes with right angles

title: toe
meaning: the portion of the bevel gear tooth near the inner end

title: heel
meaning: the portion of the bevel gear tooth near the outer end

title: front angle
meaning: the angle between an element of the front cone and a plane of rotation

title: face angle
meaning: the between an element of the face cone and its axis

title: shaft angle
meaning: the angle between meshing bevel gear axes: also, the sum of the two pitch angles

title: root angle
meaning: the angle formed between a tooth element and the axis of the bevel gear

title: pitch apex to back
meaning: the distance along the axis from apex of pitch cone to a locating registering surface on back

title: crown to back
meaning: the distance from the crown to the rear of the gear

title: crown
meaning: the sharp corner forming the outside diameter

title: mounting surface
meaning: the diameter and/or plane of rotation surface which is used in locating the gear in the application assembly

title: mounting distance
meaning: for assembled bevel gears, the distance from the crossing point of the axes to the registering surface, measured along the gear axis; ideally it should be identical to the apex to back

title: back cone distance
meaning: the distance along an element of the back cone from the apex to the pitch circle

title: back cone
meaning: the angle of a cone whose elements are tangent to a sphere containing a trace of the pitch circle

title: back angle
meaning: the angle between an element of the back cone and the plane of rotation

title: cone distance
meaning: the distance from the end of the tooth to the pitch apex

title: pitch angle
meaning: the angle formed between an element of the pitch cone and the bevel gear axis, it is the half angle of the pitch cone

title: tempered fiberboard
meaning: high density fiberboard that has been specially treated with drying oil, petroleum derivatives or other compounds stabilized by baking or heating, and generally intended for the use where moisture resistance is required.

title: standard fiberboard
meaning: A high density fiberboard without subsequent treatment generally intended for interior use

title: plain
meaning: A hardboard without any factory-applied finish.

title: smooth one side
meaning: High density fiberboard with a smooth surface on one side and a screen impression on the other side.

title: v belt
meaning:
flexible machine element used to transmit motion and power between two shafts, the cross section of which is shaped roughly like a regular trapezoid outlined by the base, sides and
top of the belt

title: v pulley
meaning: wheel with one or more grooved rims used to transmit motion and power by means of one or more V-belts

title: v belt drive
meaning: power transmission device, which consists of one or more V-belts, mounted on two or more V-pulleys

title: exterior plywood
meaning: type of plywood intended for outdoor or marine uses, also known as Type I

title: face
meaning: surface of the plywood showing veneer of higher grade than that of the back side

title: face plywood
meaning: plywood faced with a material other than wood, such as metal or plastic

title: fiberboard
meaning: panel made of consolidated ligno-cellulosic fibers with the primary bond derived from their inherent adhesive properties and/or the addition of resin or other materials

title: fiber cement flat sheets
meaning: consist essentially of an inorganic hydraulic binder or a calcium silicate binder formed by the chemical reaction of a siliceous material and a calcareous material reinforced by organic fibers and/or inorganic synthetic fibers

title: interior plywood
meaning: type of plywood intended for inside use, having limited moisture resistance

title: lumber core
meaning: side board made up of well machined lumber strips properly dried and glued together

title: lumber core plywood
meaning: ply board; plywood made up of face/back veneer, crossboard core veneer and well composed kiln dried lumber core

title: panel
meaning: sheet of plywood

title: particle board
meaning: board principally made from wood chips and formed by hot press process with adhesive

title: ply
meaning: stratum or layer used in referring to the successive layers of veneer in a panel

title: plywood
meaning:
assembled product made of layers of veneers and/or lumber core held together by an
adhesive, the chief characteristics of which is the alternate cross layers, distributing the longitudinal wood strength

title: decorative
meaning: Hardboard which has a pattern impressed on one surface, e.g. simulating some other materials such as leather, sawali, wood grain, bark, diamond, fine weave, and others

title: perforated
meaning: Usually S1S hardboard with holes punched or drilled at the factory for use with various fixtures to provide decorative wall-mounted storage facilities or which may be used for acoustic purposes.

title: smooth two sides
meaning: High density fiberboard with smooth surfaces on both sides.

title: class 1 dry conditions
meaning: This bonding class is appropriate for veneer plywood intended for use in normal interior climates.

title: class 2 humid conditions
meaning: This bonding class is appropriate for veneer plywood intended for protected external applications (e.g. behind cladding or under roof coverings), but capable of resisting weather exposure for short periods (e.g. when exposed during construction).

title: class 3 exterior conditions
meaning: This bonding class is designed for veneer plywood intended for exposure to weather over sustained periods.

title: acetals
meaning:
This provides high strength and stiffness while offering enhanced dimensional stability and ease of machining. A semi-crystalline material, acetal also has a low coefficient of friction
and good wear properties-especially in wet environments.

title: polyamide
meaning: one of the most versatile and widely used thermoplastic materials. Its physical properties and reasonable price combine to make it a popular choice for numerous applications.

title: polyamide
meaning: Engineering plastic which can replace steel, brass, bronze, aluminum, wood, and rubber, while reducing noise, using less lubrication, and increasing gear life.

title: polycarbonate
meaning: an amorphous thermoplastic with excellent dimensional stability and good strength and stiffness over a wide range of service temperatures. It is often used for structural applications when transparency and impact strength are essential

title: polycarbonate
meaning: suits a wide variety of electrical applications as well, because of its low moisture absorption, good insulation and excellent flammability rating.

title: polyethylene umhwpe
meaning: It is an inexpensive alternative to metals, ceramics, and wood because it is self-lubricating; long-wearing; and shatter-, abrasion-, and corrosion-resistant.

title: polypropylene
meaning: noted for its light weight, being less dense than water; it is a polymer of propylene. It resists moisture, oils, and solvents

title: polytetrafluoroethylene
meaning: It is more popularly known as Teflon, and is based on chain of carbon atoms, the same as all polymers.

title: polyvinyl chloride
meaning: a thermoplastic that is a polymer of vinyl chloride.This plastic has found extensive use as an electrical insulator for wires and cables.

title: acrylic
meaning: It can be machined or cemented and, with standard equipment, will fabricate like wood, metal, or other plastics. It weighs half as much as comparable glass and yet has good shatter resistance and durability.

title: split
meaning: Pin used as locking device for other fasteners. Used with a slotted nut on bolt, screws, or studs, it provides a convenient, low-cost locknut assembly.

title: taper
meaning: Pin used for light-duty service in the attachment of wheels, levers and similar components to shafts

title: parallel or dowel
meaning: Pin holding laminated sections together with surfaces either drawn up tight or separated in some fixed relationship.

title: parallel or dowel
meaning: Pin for fastening machine parts where accuracy of alignment is a primary consideration.

title: parallel or dowel
meaning: Pin for locking components on shafts.

title: clevis
meaning: Pin used in connecting mating yoke, or fork, and eye members in knuckle-joint assemblies

title: single row radial
meaning: This bearing is often referred to as the deep groove or conrad bearing

title: single row radial
meaning: Bearing which is availablein many variations such as single, double shields, and seals.

title: single row radial
meaning: This type of bearing is normally used for radial; and thrust loads (maximum two-thirds of radial).

title: maximum capacity bearing
meaning: bearings which have a geometry that is similar to that of a deep-groove bearing except for a filling slot

title: double row
meaning: This bearing provides for heavy radial and light thrust loads without increasing the outside diameter of the bearing. It is about 60 to 80 percent wider than a comparable single-row bearing. Because of the filling slot, thrust loads may be light.

title: internal self-aligning double-row
meaning: This bearing may be used for primarily radial loads where self-alignment (4) is required. The self-aligning feature should not be abused, as excessive misalignment or thrust load (10 percent of radial) causes early failure.

title: angular contact bearing
meaning: These bearings are designed to support combined radial and thrust loads or heavy thrust loads depending on the contact-angle magnitude

title: ball bushings
meaning: This type of bearing is used for linear motions on hardened shafts (Rockwell C 58 to 64). Some types can be used for linear and rotary motions

title: split type ball bearing
meaning: This type of ball or roller bearing has split inner, outer ring, and cage, which are assembled by screws. This feature is expensive but useful where it is difficult to install or remove a solid bearing.

title: ball thrust bearing
meaning: Bearings which may be used for low-speed applications where other bearings carry the radial load. These bearings are made with shields, as well as the open type.

title: cylindrical roller
meaning: These bearings utilize cylinders with approximate length/diameter ratio ranging from 1:1 to 1:3 as rolling elements. It Bearings which are normally used for heavy radial loads and especially useful for free axial movement of the shaft. They also have the highest speed limits for roller bearings.

title:
These bearings have rollers whose length is at least 4 times their diameter. They are the most useful where space is a factor and are available with or without inner race, it must be
hardened or ground.
meaning: needle bearing

title: Type of needle bearing which is used for high loads, oscillating, or slow speeds.
meaning: full-complement type

title: Type of needle bearing which should be used for rotational motion. They cannot support thrust loads.
meaning: cage type

title: These bearings are used for heavy radial and thrust loads. They are designed so that all elements in the rolling surface and the raceways intersect at a common point on the axis: thus true rolling is obtained.
meaning: tapered roller

title: These bearings are excellent for heavy radial loads and moderate thrust.
meaning: spherical roller

title: These bearings are made of a series of short rollers to minimize the skidding, which causes twisting of the rollers. They may be used for moderate speeds and loads.
meaning: straight-roller thrust bearing

title: It eliminates the skidding that takes place with straight rollers but causes a thrust load between the ends of the rollers and the shoulder on the race. Thus speeds are limited because the roller end and race flange are in sliding contact.
meaning: tapered-roller thrust bearing

title: Washer used to produce a predetermined pressure on adjacent members where sliding action is desired, or to serve as spring take-up devices in an assembly.
meaning: spring lock washer

title: Washer used with screws to add spring take-up to screw elongation.
meaning: conical spring washer

title: Toothed lock washer used when projection of teeth beyond the head or nut is objectionable.
meaning: internal toothed

title: Toothed lock washer used when security of assembly is critical.
meaning: external toothed

title: Toothed lock washer used under countersunk screw heads.
meaning: countersunk external toothed

title: Tooth locked washer used against soft materials and thin steel sheet
meaning: internal external toothed

title: Washer which provides bearing surface for a nut or screw head, covers large clearance holes, and distribute fastener loads over large area, particularly on soft materials such as aluminum or wood.
meaning: plain washer

title: Washer used with screws and nuts not only to effectively add spring take-up to the screw elongation but to increase the frictional resistance under the screw hard or nut face.
meaning: toothed lock washer

title: stripping efficiency
meaning: ratio of the total dry weight (moisture content of 14%) of the fiber extracted to the potential fiber content of abaca tuxies, expressed in percent

title: extraction loss
meaning: difference between the potential fiber content of abaca tuxies and dry weight (moisture content of 14%) of the actual fiber extracted using abaca stripper, expressed in percent

title: fiber quality
meaning: refers to the physical properties such as tensile strength, length, color and texture (fineness and coarseness) of fibers extracted

title: grade
meaning: indicator of the quality or the characteristics of the physical property of a fiber

title: output capacity
meaning: fresh weight of the output fiber extracted from the abaca stripper per unit time, kg/h

title: overall height
meaning: distance between the horizontal supporting plane surface and the horizontal plane touching the uppermost part of the stripping machine

title: overall length
