meaning: distance between the vertical planes at the right angles to the median plane of the abaca stripper and touching its front and rear extremities

title: overall width
meaning: distance between the vertical planes parallel to the median plane of the machine, each plane touching the outermost point of the stripper on its respective side

title: potential fiber content
meaning: summation of the weight of extracted fiber using manual or mechanical abaca stripper and unextracted fiber manually obtained

title: running-in period
meaning: preliminary operation of the machine to make various adjustments prior to the conduct of test until the operation is stable

title: potential fiber recovery
meaning: ratio of fresh weight of fiber extracted and the total fresh weight of input abaca tuxies to the abaca stripper, expressed in percent

title: abaca fiber
meaning: long and slender natural filament of abaca plant

title: abaca stalk
meaning: part of abaca plant which consist of several layers of leaf sheath

title: abaca stripper
meaning: mechanical device used for extracting primary fibers by scraping action from blade and stripping block

title: bacnis method
meaning: method that uses bolo to partially cut (leaving the upper layer 1 mm to 2 mm thick uncut) crosswise the middle of the inner portion of the leaf sheath to be able to extract the tuxies

title: tuxy
meaning: the outer layer of abaca leaf sheath which contains the primary fiber

title: locnit method
meaning: method that uses tuxying knife to thrust one side of the leaf sheath and make a cut between the upper and the inner portions of the material to be able to extract the tuxies

title: parenchymatous material
meaning: soft tissue or non-fibrous material attached to the fiber

title: stripping
meaning: extracting the fiber from abaca tuxies using abaca stripper

title: stripping block
meaning: part of the abaca stripper that provides friction and where raw materials are being locked in position during fiber extraction

title: tuxying
meaning: separating the outer layer from inner layer of leaf sheath which is at most 1.8 mm of abaca leaf sheath either by locnit method (using tuxying knife) or bacnis method (using bolo)

title: stripping knife
meaning: metal plate, non-serrated or serrated, that provides stripping action

title: burning efficiency
meaning: ratio of the actual and the theoretical heating value of fuel, expressed in percent

title: furnace efficiency
meaning: ratio of the actual and the theoretical heating value of fuel, expressed in percent

title: latent heat of vaporization
meaning: heat absorbed by a unit mass of a material at its boiling point in order to convert the material into a gas without temperature change

title: sensible heat
meaning: heat absorbed or evolved by a substance during a change of temperature that is not accompanied by a change of state

title: heating system efficiency
meaning: ratio of actual and theoretical heat supplied by the fuel to the furnace, expressed in percent

title: biomass
meaning: organic materials used as renewable source of energy like wood chips, corncobs and rice hulls, etc.

title: biomass furnace
meaning: enclosed structure for intense heating by fire using any biomass like woodchips, corncobs and rice hulls as fuel

title: hearth
meaning: fire resistant surface located at the heating chamber of the biomass furnace

title: workload
meaning: materials to be processed (i.e. dried, burned, melted, etc.) using biomass furnace

title: grate
meaning: framework of metal bars or fire bricks used to hold biomass fuel in furnace for more efficient combustion

title: shredding efficiency
meaning: ratio of the weight of the input biomass materials less unshredded biomass materials, to the total weight of the input biomass materials to the shredder, expressed in percent

title: input capacity
meaning: weight of biomass material fed into the shredder, expressed in kilogram per hour

title: unshredded
meaning: biomass material that is not totally cut into strips

title: biomass shredder
meaning: machine used to cut biomass materials into strips

title: chipping section
meaning: part of a shredding machine which is used to cut or sliced twigs or small branches of trees into small and uniform sizes called chips

title: hopper
meaning: part of the biomass shredder where the biomass materials to be cut are loaded

title: prime mover
meaning: electric motor or internal combustion engine used to drive the biomass shredder

title: chip
meaning: thin slice of material with thickness of about 4 mm

title: chipping machine
meaning: chipper; size reduction machine either power or manually operated which is used to cut or slice root crops or banana into small thin pieces called chips

title: chipping capacity
meaning: amount of material that can be processed per unit time, kg/h

title: cutterhead
meaning: cutting rotor; devices intended to slice the crop into chips with reasonable consistency within a range of optional settings

title: discharge chute
meaning: opening through which chipped material is thrown out

title: flywheel type
meaning: type of chipping machine with knives mounted radially with the cutting edges describing a plane perpendicular to the axis of rotation

title: guard
meaning: component intended to provide protection for the operator or bystander from injury

title: drum type
meaning: knives on cylindrical mountings such that the cutting edges of the knives are essentially parallel to the axis of rotation

title: coconut husk
meaning: fibrous covering of a coconut fruit comprising of 30% fiber and 70% parenchymatous cells

title: coconut coir
meaning: slender and elongated fibrous materials extracted from coconut husk

title: coconut peat
meaning: fine and powder-like particles parenchymatous cells that are extracted from the coconut husk

title: coconut coir decorticator
meaning: machine to crush matured coconut husk through impact or beating action to separate coco fiber and coconut peat from the husk

title: decorticating efficiency
meaning: ratio of the weight of the input coconut husk partially and totally undecorticated coconut husk to the total weight of the input coconut husk to the decorticator, expressed in percent

title: coir quality
meaning: refers to the physical and morphological (e.g. tensile strength, maturity, color, fiber length and cleanliness) properties of fibers extracted

title: undecorticated
meaning: portion of the coconut husk that is partially crushed and totally crushed

title: desiccators
meaning: container where oven-dried samples are cooled without affecting its moisture content

title: crude oil production rate
meaning: quantity of crude oil that the expeller can extract per unit of time, expressed in kilogram per hour

title: purity
meaning: amount of input test material free of foreign matter expressed as percentage of the total weight of the sample

title: wet copra meal
meaning: copra residue that pass through the expeller barrel together with the crude oil but is filtered by the perforated screen placed at the entrance of the crude oil chute

title: choke
meaning: permit a final adjustment of pressure and capacity in order to correct variations in the raw material and to secure the lowest possible oil content of the copra meal residue

title: copra
meaning: dried coconut meat from which oil is extracted

title: copra meal
meaning: residue collected after extracting oil from milled copra

title: crude oil
meaning: freshly extracted coconut oil containing moisture, fiber, resins, colors, etc. from copra

title: expeller barrel
meaning: barrel or cage consists of a heavy cradle-type frame into which flat steel bars are set edgewise around the periphery, therefore parallel to the worm shaft functioning as a screen

title: extraction chamber
meaning: part of the oil expeller where the extraction process occurs

title: oil expeller
meaning: motor-driven extrusion type machine capable of extracting crude oil from copra for use in cooking, soapmaking, or as ingredient in other foods such as baked or fried goods

title: worm shaft
meaning: a kind of a screw which has the double task of conveying the raw material through the pressure chamber formed by the barrel, and at the same time of exerting a pressure on it

title: mechanically damaged parchment coffee
meaning: ratio of the total weight of damaged parchment coffee to the total weight of sample, expressed in percentage

title: separation loss
meaning: ratio of the total weight of the parchment coffee that comes out to the pulp discharge to the total input weight of coffee cherry to the pulper, expressed in percentage

title: pulping efficiency
meaning: ratio of total weight of parchment coffee collected at all outlets to the total coffee cherry input to the machine, expressed in percentage

title: pulping recovery
meaning: ratio between the total weight of parchment coffee collected at the main outlet to the total weight of input coffee cherry to the machine, expressed in percentage

title: unpulped loss
meaning: ratio of the total weight of unpulped coffee cherry to the total input weight of coffee cherry to the pulper, expressed in percentage

title: scattering loss
meaning: ratio of the total weight of the parchment coffee that fell around the base of coffee pulper to the total coffee cherry input to the machine, expressed in percentage by weight

title: coffee pulper
meaning: machine to remove and separate the soft pulp of ripe coffee cherry without making any damage to the parchment coffee

title: coffee cherry
meaning: ripened fruits of coffee shrubs

title: flute
meaning: thread like component of rotating cylinder of the pulping chamber

title: flute inclination
meaning: angle of inclination of the rubber coated flutes

title: pulping
meaning: process of removing and separating the skin and pulp of coffee cherry

title: mucilage
meaning: slimy layer found between the pulp and adhering to the parchment

title: parchment
meaning: endocarp of the coffee cherry, lies between the fleshy part (or pulp) of the cherry and coffee bean

title: parchment coffee
meaning: final output product when the coffee cherry has undergone pulping process

title: main parchment coffee outlet
meaning: part of machine where parchment coffee are collected

title: pulp outlet
meaning: part of machine where pulps are collected

title: pulp
meaning: red or green thin fleshy outer layer of the coffee cherry

title: aspirator
meaning: cleaner that uses air to separate lower density material from the corn kernels/corn grits such as floured corn, germ and bran

title: bulk density
meaning: ratio of the weight (kg) of the corn kernels, to its volume (m3)

title: degerminated corn kenels
meaning: shelled corn kernels where the germ and pericarp have been removed

title: feed rate
meaning: weight of the corn kernels fed into the corn mill per unit of time

title: foreign matter
meaning: impurity; any matter which is not corn kernels/corn grits or fragment of corn kernels/corn grits sand, gravel, dirt, pebbles, stones, lumps of earth, clay, mud, weeds and other crop seeds

title: laboratory sieve shaker
meaning: equipment with definite shaking motion used to sort the size of the milled materials using standard screen sieves

title: milling capacity
meaning: quantity of corn kernels that the corn mill can process to produce corn grits per unit of time

title: precleaner
meaning: auxiliary device of the corn mill that removes foreign material

title: sifter
meaning:
oscillating screen; wire mesh or perforated metal sheet, moving in back-and-forth direction, permitting smaller
particles to fall through the openings and larger particles to remain on top

title: bran
meaning: 'tahop'; coarse powder from outer covering of the corn kernel removed during the milling process

title: by-product
meaning: refers to corn grit # 20 and # 24, floured corn, germ and bran

title: by-product recovery
meaning: ratio of the weight of by-products, to the total weight of corn kernel input, expressed in percent

title: corn kernels
meaning: shelled corn of either dent or flint varieties

title: corn grits
meaning: milled corn kernels where the outer covering and germs have been removed and with particle size of not less than 0.86 mm

title: grit #10
meaning: milled corn kernels with particle size between 1.8 mm to 2.0 mm

title: grit #12
meaning: milled corn kernels with particle size between 1.5 mm to 1.7 mm

title: grit #14
meaning: milled corn kernels with particle size between 1.2 mm to 1.4 mm

title: grit #16
meaning: milled corn kernels with particle size between 1.10 mm to 1.19 mm

title: grit #18
meaning: milled corn kernels with particle size between 0.86 mm to 1.09 mm

title: conditioning
meaning: rewetting of dried corn kernels to about 18% to 22% moisture content and tempering it to make the pericarp and the germ more pliable and easier to remove

title: corn mill
meaning: equipment used to produce corn grits using the dry milling process

title: degerminator
meaning: machine used to remove the germ and pericarp from the corn kernel

title: degerminator efficiency
meaning: ratio of the weight of degerminated corn kernel sample, to the initial weight of the sample, expressed in percent

title: dry milling
meaning: process of reducing the corn kernels into pieces of grits, germ and pericarp with or without conditioning

title: floured corn
meaning: fines; 'tiktik'; fine powder by-product of corn milling process

title: germ
meaning: 'sungo'; embryo of the kernel removed during the degermination process

title: grit #20
meaning: corn grit by-product with particle size between 0.70 mm to 0.85 mm

title: grit #24
meaning: corn grit by-product with particle size smaller than 0.70 mm

title: main product
meaning: refers to corn grit # 10, #12, #14, #16, and # 18

title: main product recovery
meaning: ratio of the weight of corn grits, to the total weight of corn kernel input, expressed in percent

title: moisture content
meaning: amount of moisture in the corn kernels expressed as percent of the total weight of the sample, wet basis

title: roller mill
meaning: major component of the corn mill used to reduce corn kernels into corn grits.

title: actual field capacity
meaning: actual rate of being able to harvest corn in a given area per unit of time

title: corn
meaning: (Zea mays); cereal grass belonging to the Poaceae family

title: corn ear
meaning: fruit of the corn plant with husk

title: single-row side- mounted corn picker
meaning: machine attached to the side of tractor designed for picking corn

title: conveyance efficiency
meaning: measures the ability of the corn picker to deliver the harvested corn ear to the collecting bin

title: field efficiency
meaning: ratio of the actual field capacity and theoretical field capacity, expressed in percent

title: picking efficiency
meaning: measures the ability of the corn picker to harvest the corn ear from the corn stalk through snapping and stripping action

title: potential yield
meaning: maximum yield per unit area

title: theoretical field capacity
meaning: computed rate of harvested corn in a given area per unit time

title: width
meaning: longitudinal dimension of a roll in right angle to the diameter

title: snapping rolls
meaning: part of the corn picker that pulls the corn stalk downward thereby, stripping the corn ear during operation

title: stalk guide rod
meaning: direct the stalks of the corn plant to the snapping rolls

title: stripper plate
meaning: part of the corn picker that prevents the corn stalk from bending and separate the corn ear from the stalk

title: biomass fuel
meaning: type of fuel from living organisms such as plants, animals and their by-products

title: cooking losses
meaning: total percent of ginger tea (instant 'salabat') loss based on the recovered product

title: cooking rate
meaning: quantity of juice that the crystallizer can cook per unit of time, expressed in kilogram per hour

title: cooking recovery
meaning: ratio between the total weight of recovered ginger tea (instant 'salabat') and the weight of sugar added to the input juice, expressed in percentage

title: fineness modulus
meaning: principal factor which indicates the uniformity of ginger tea (instant 'salabat')

title: ginger tea quality
meaning: refers to the physical and chemical properties of the product, instant 'salabat'

title: holding capacity
meaning: weight of input juice per batch, expressed in kilogram

title: liquified petroleum gas
meaning: type of fuel used in cooking ginger juice

title: operating time
meaning: length of time measured from the time the burner is turned on until it is turned off

title: burner
meaning: main source of heat used in cooking ginger juice

title: crystallizer
meaning: machine that cooks ginger juice to produce ginger tea (instant 'salabat')

title: cooking basin
meaning: part of the crystallizer where ginger juice are being loaded for cooking operation

title: ginger tea (instant 'salabat')
meaning: crystallized form of ginger from its juice

title: paddle
meaning: component of the crystallizer that is used in stirring to attain the desired consistency of the mixture to produce ginger tea (instant 'salabat')

title: airflow rate
meaning: volume of air in cubic meters delivered to the mass of dehusked corn per minute

title: damaged kernels
meaning: corn kernels which are heat damaged, weather damaged, sprouted or distinctly damaged by insects, water, fungi and/or any other means

title: drying air temperature
meaning: mean temperature of the air to be used for drying the dehusked corn, measured at a number of points practicably as close to its entry to the drying bed

title: drying capacity
meaning: maximum capacity that the dehusked corn dryer can dry to meet the desired moisture content

title: fuel consumption
meaning: total amount of fuel consumed divided by the total drying time, expressed in kg/h

title: moisture reduction rate
meaning: ratio of the average percent moisture content removed from the dehusked corn to drying time, expressed in percent per hour

title: static pressure
meaning: pressure build-up in the plenum chamber to maintain uniform dustribution of air flow through the dehusked corn mass, expressed in mmH2O

title: dehusked corn
meaning: ear corn; corn-on-cob; unshelled fruit of the corn plant where the husk has been removed mechanically or manually

title: husk
meaning: refers to the leafy outer/protective covering of an ear of corn as it grows on the plant

title: dehusked corn dryer
meaning: device for removing excess moisture from the ear of corn without husk, generally by forced or natural convection with or without addition of heat

title: fan
meaning: blower; air moving device that is used to force heated air through the mass of materials to be dried at the desired air flow rate and pressure

title: moisture gradient
meaning: difference between the maximum and the minimum moisture content randomly sampled after drying

title: plenum
meaning: chamber wherein air pressure is developed for uniform distribution of the heated air through the material to be dried

title: safety device
meaning:
any device that is used to avoid human accident and/or damage to the parts and
components of the dryer during the operation and automatically shuts-off the operation of the dryer in case of malfunction

title: air power
meaning: part of the energy per unit time that is imparted by the fan to the air by increasing its total pressure from the inlet to the outlet

title: angle of attack
meaning: angle measured between the air inlet and the lower camber of the fan/blower

title: back-flow
meaning: when the air flow/movement produces by fan/blower starts to reverse direction

title: hub-tip ratio
meaning: ratio between the hub diameter and the fan/blower wheel diameter

title: lift-drag ratio
meaning: ratio between the lift force and the drag force on fan/blower blades during operation

title: pitot tube
meaning: tube that is being connected to a manometer and is being used to measure the static and total force of air in the testing duct of fan/blower

title: static air power
meaning: part of the energy per unit time that is imparted by the fan/blower to the air in overcoming static pressure from the inlet to the outlet

title: throttling device
meaning: conical structure or orifice rings that are being used at the end of testing duct of fan/blower to enable variation in air volumetric flow rate

title: total pressure
meaning: sum of the static and velocity pressure

title: traverse point
meaning: point in the duct at which measurement using pitot tube shall be done

title: velocity pressure
meaning: pressure along the line of the flow that result from the air flowing through the duct

title: airfoil
meaning: shape of a wing or blade of a propeller, rotor, or turbine or sails as seen in cross section

title: camber
meaning: asymmetry between the top and the bottom curves of an airfoil in cross-section

title: drag
meaning: force cause by friction which slows down the movement of an object

title: fan/blower guard
meaning: structure mounted on the inlet and/or outlet part of fan/blower for safety purpose

title: lift
meaning: sum of all the forces on a body that force it to move perpendicular to the direction of flow

title: leading edge
meaning: side of the fan/blower blade where the air comes in contact with at entry

title: trailing edge
meaning: side of the fan/blower blade that is usually pointed and where the deflection of air occurs

title: rotor
meaning: rotating device with blades projecting from a hub

title: fan/blower wheel
meaning: any revolving vane or vanes used for producing currents of air

title: mixing rate
meaning: weight of feed ingredients fed into the feed mixer per unit time, expressed in kilogram per hour.

title: coefficient of variation of salt content
meaning: statistical representation of the precision of distribution of feed ingredients

title: mean
meaning: mathematical average of the samples taken from the feed mixed

title: standard deviation
meaning: statistical measurement of dispersion or variation in distribution of feed ingredients

title: feeds
meaning: meal type, pellets or crumble type of food that are mixed from various raw materials and additive

title: feed mixer
meaning: machine used to mix uniformly the feed ingredients

title: coefficient of variation
meaning: statistical representation of the precision of distribution of feed ingredients

title: cleaning
meaning: the method or extent of extracting (by retting or decorticating) the fiber from the leaves

title: color
meaning: principal factor which determine the grade of a fiber

title: cylinder length
meaning: distance between the outermost points along the cylinder base axis

title: cylinder peripheral speed
meaning: equivalent linear speed of the cylinder tip when running at normal operating speed

title: elongation
meaning: elasticity or stretch of a fiber before rupture

title: effective allowance
meaning: distance between the scraper block/breaker block and blades in order to separate fiber elements from the non-fiber elements of the plant

title: effective cylinder diameter
meaning: outside diameter generated by the outermost point of the cylinder decorticating elements

title: extraction efficiency
meaning: ratio of the amount between the total weight of the fiber extracted to the total amount of fiber content on a dry basis

title: labor requirement
meaning: number of persons needed in the operation of the fiber decorticator

title: morphological properties
meaning: properties of the fiber which deal with its anatomical characteristics such as length, diameter, lumen and wall thickness

title: output capacity
meaning: dry weight of the fiber at 13-14% moisture content extracted per unit time*

title: physical properties
meaning: inherent strength and behavior of fibers under applied force which determines the mechanical serviceability or usefulness in commerce such as tensile strength, cleaning and color

title: total decorticating input
meaning: sum of the weights of collected decorticated fiber and all losses

title: fiber
meaning: slender and greatly elongated natural filament of fiber plant

title: fiber decorticator
meaning: decorticator; mechanical device used for extracting fibers by crushing, beating and scraping actions effected by the rotating cylinder with equally spaced blades and breaker or scraper block

title: scraper block
meaning: breaker block; part of the decorticator where raw materials are beaten up and crushed

title: chopping efficiency
meaning: ratio of the weight of the fresh chopped materials collected at all outlets, to the total fresh weight of the input of the chopper, expressed in percent

title: forage
meaning: any crop used as silage, soilage or animal feed, usually mixed with fermenting agents

title: feeding table
meaning: part of the forage chopper where the forage to be chopped are loaded

title: blow-up type
meaning: type of forage chopper where the chopped materials are blown up through the blow-up pipe

title: cylinder cutterhead
meaning: knives on cylindrical mountings such that the cutting edges of the knives are essentially parallel to the axis of rotation

title: feedroll
meaning: cylindrical roll generally with protrusions or flutes, used to gather, compress and advance the crop into the cutterhead

title: flywheel cutterhead
meaning: knives mounted essentially radially with the cutting edges describing a plane perpendicular to the axis of rotation

title: forage chopper
meaning: machine used to cut the crop into short parallel lengths

title: let-fall type
meaning: type of forage chopper where the chopped materials are dropped down to the bottom of machine

title: precision-cut forage chopper
meaning: forage chopper which uses a feeding mechanism consisting of four or more feed rolls to partially orient and advance the crop at a consistent rate into the cutting mechanism

title: random-cut forage chopper
meaning: forage chopper without a distinct feeding mechanism, usually employing flails to impact- cut and chop crop directly into shorter pieces

title: semi-precision-cut forage chopper
meaning: forage chopper which uses a feeding mechanism consisting of two feed rolls, or other means such as an auger, to advance the crop to the cutting mechanism

title: stationary knife
meaning: shear bar; fixed plate providing a stationary edge against which the cutterhead knives shear the crop

title: throw-away type
meaning: type of forage chopper where the chopped materials are thrown away to the front area of the machine

title: drying efficiency
meaning: heat utilization efficiency; ratio of the total heat utilized to vaporize moisture in the material, to the amount of heat added to the drying air, expressed in percent

title: drying rate
meaning: amount of water removed per unit of time, expressed in kilogram per hour

title: drying system efficiency
meaning: ratio of the total heat utilized for drying, to the heat available in the fuel expressed in percent

title: heat utilization
meaning: total amount of heat utilized to vaporize moisture in the material, expressed in kJ/kg of water

title: fruit
meaning: ripened ovary or ovaries of a seed-bearing plant that are edible, usually sweet and in fleshy form

title: fruit dryer
meaning: device for removing excess moisture from the fruits, generally by forced or natural convection with or without addition of heat

title: water activity
meaning: ratio of vapor pressure of water in the product to the water vapor pressure of pure water at the same temperature.

title: hammer mill
meaning: device used for milling which consists of rotating hammer(s) and a heavy perforated screen at the bottom

title: reduction ratio
meaning: ratio of the average size of input to the average size of the product

title: burner efficiency
meaning: furnace efficiency; ratio of the heat supplied by the burner/furnace, to the heat released by the fuel

title: combustion efficiency
meaning: ratio of the heat released by the fuel, to the theoretical heat available from the fuel

title: conventional energy source
meaning: source of energy which includes petroleum-based fuels such as kerosene, gasoline, diesel oil and bunker fuel oil

title: damaged grains
meaning: grains which are heat damaged, weather damaged, sprouted or distinctly damaged by insects, water, fungi and/or any other means

title: grain holding capacity
meaning:
load capacity; continuous flow dryer: weight of grain in the dryer after a period of stable operation batch type dryer: weight of grain required to fill the dryer at the input moisture
content

title: immature grains
meaning: palay which are light green and chalky with soft texture

title: non-conventional energy source
meaning: source of energy that includes non-petroleum based fuels such as biomass and solar energy

title: scattered grains
meaning: ratio of the weight of grains that fell out from the machine during the drying operation, to the weight of the total grain input to the dryer, expressed in percent

title: tempering
meaning: temporarily holding the grain between the drying passes, allowing the moisture content in the center of the grain and that on the surface of the grain to equalize

title: batch type
meaning: mechanical grain dryer wherein the grain in fixed volume is held in the drying chamber in batches until the grain reaches the desired moisture content

title: flat bed type
meaning: shallow bed batch type dryer wherein a fixed volume of grain is held stationary in a horizontal grain holding bin

title: recirculating type
meaning: batch type dryer equipped to circulate and/or mixed fixed volume of grain during the drying operation

title: vertical bin type
meaning: columnar type; batch type dryer wherein a fixed volume of grain is held stationary in a vertical grain holding bin

title: continuous flow dryer
meaning: dryer in which the material being dried moves through the drying chamber in a substantially continuous stream and is discharged without being recirculated

title: concurrent flow type
meaning:
parallel flow type; continuous flow dryer wherein the product being dried moves in the same direction as drying
air

title: counter-flow type
meaning: continuous flow dryer wherein the grain being dried move in one direction and the drying air moves in the opposite direction

title: cross-flow type
meaning: continuous flow dryer wherein the flow of air is transverse to the direction of flow of the grain being dried

title: mixing type
meaning: continuous flow dryer wherein the drying bin is similar to columnar drying bin except that it includes louvers causing mixing to occur as the grain flows through the system

title: non-mixing type
meaning: continuous flow dryer wherein the grains in the drying bin flows through the column in a straight path

title: cracked grain
meaning: grains which show signs of fissures or fractures or splinters

title: direct fired dryer
meaning: dryer in which the products of combustion come into direct contact with the product being dried

title: indirect fired dryer
meaning: dryer in which the products of combustion do not come in contact with the products being dried

title: dust collecting system
meaning: device used to collect dust ( i.e. consist of aspiration fan, cyclone, etc.)

title: grain dryer
meaning: device for removing excess moisture from the grain, generally by forced or natural convection with or without addition of heat

title: head rice
meaning: grain or a fraction of grain with its length equal to or greater than eight-tenth (8/10) of the average length of the whole grain

title: heated-air mechanical grain dryer
meaning: device used to remove grain moisture by forcing heated air through the grain mass until the desired moisture content is attained

title: multi-pass dryer
meaning: mechanical grain dryer wherein grain is passed intermittently in cycles or stages through a drying chamber either by mechanical means or by gravity with subsequent cooling and tempering until the grain reaches the desired moisture content

title: actual capacity
meaning: the weight of the threshed grain collected from the main grain outlet per unit time

title: clean threshed grain
meaning: threshed grain with 100% purity exclusive of the empty grains and other impurities

title: concave clearance
meaning: clearance between cylinder threshing elements and concave component

title: concave component
meaning: an iron grill frame partly surrounding the cylinder on which the threshing elements rubs, shear and/or impact the cut plants

title: corrected capacity
meaning: the corrected capacity of the thresher at 20% grain moisture content (wet basis), grain- straw ratio of 0.55 and 100% purity

title: grain-straw ratio
meaning:
grain content; the ratio of the weight of the grains present in the panicles, to the total weight of the grain and
straw in the same sample

title: lower concave
meaning: semi-circular shaped wire mesh or bar grate covering the lower portion of the threshing chamber which causes the grains to separate from the panicles

title: threshing output
meaning: the weight of the threshed grains collected at the grain outlet

title: total grain input
meaning: sum of the weights of collected threshed grains and all threshing losses

title: upper concave
meaning: a semi-circular shaped grate at the upper portion of the threshing cylinder with louvers which assist threshing and axial movement of the straw

title: axial flow thresher
meaning: throw-in type of thresher which allows the cut plants to move in a helical manner around the threshing cylinder with a net effect of moving the material axially between the feeding and discharge outlets

title: blower loss
meaning: ratio of the weight of grains blown with the chaff by the thresher fan, to the weight of the total grain input of the thresher, expressed in percent

title: chaff
meaning: empty grains and crushed straw being discharged from the threshing chamber

title: concave grate
meaning: concave component; iron grill frame partially or fully surrounding the cylinder on which the threshing elements rubs, shear and/or impact the cut plants

title: hold-on thresher
meaning: type of thresher wherein the panicles of the cut plants are fed into the threshing chamber while the stalks are mechanically or manually held during the threshing operation

title: mechanically damaged grain
meaning: grains that were broken and/or dehulled (partially or fully) as a result of threshing operation

title: mechanical rice thresher
meaning: machine used to detach and separate the palay from the panicles

title: palay
meaning: paddy; rice; rough rice; unhulled grain of Oryza sativa L., that is, grain with the hull/husk

title: peg-tooth cylinder
meaning: type of threshing cylinder wherein spikes or pegs are attached on the periphery of the cylinder in tandem or in helical arrangements

title: rasp-bar cylinder
meaning: type of threshing cylinder wherein threshing is done between bar-like protrusions in parallel orientation laid on the periphery of the cylinder and stationary bars built into or attached to the concave grate

title: rated engine speed
meaning: engine speed indicated in revolutions per minute (rpm) of the engine shaft as specified by the engine manufacturer for operation at nominal continuous load

title: straw length
meaning: cut plants length measured from the point of cut to the tip of the panicle

title: threshed grain
meaning: grains that are detached from the panicles by the thresher inclusive of mature, immature, and damaged grains

title: threshing unit
meaning: threshing chamber; part of the thresher where the grains are detached and separated from the panicles

title: threshing cylinder
meaning: threshing drum; part of the threshing unit that rotates about an axis and it is equipped with either pegs, rasp bars, or wire loops on its periphery

title: threshing efficiency
meaning: ratio of the weight of the threshed grains collected at all outlets, to the total grain input of the thresher, expressed in percent

title: threshing element
meaning: attachments of the threshing cylinder such as pegtooth, wire-loop and rasp-bar that detaches the grains from the panicles

title: threshing recovery
meaning: ratio of the weight of the threshed grains collected at the main grain outlet, to the weight of the total grain input of the thresher, expressed in percent

title: through flow thresher
meaning: throw-in type of thresher wherein cut plants are fed between the rotating cylinder and stationary concave and the threshed materials/straws are discharged out of the threshing chamber tangentially

title: throw-in thresher
meaning: type of thresher which detaches the grains by feeding the cut plants into the machine

title: unthreshed loss
meaning: ratio of the weight of grains that remained in the panicles of the plants fed into the threshing chamber, to the weight of total grain input of the thresher, expressed in percent

title: wire-loop cylinder
meaning: type of threshing cylinder wherein wires of the same arc and size are attached on the periphery of the cylinder in tandem arrangement with or without the threshing concave

title: bran streaks
meaning: longitudinal bran layers remaining in the dorsal grooves after milling

title: brewer's rice
meaning: 'binlid'; small pieces or particles of grains that pass through a sieve with round perforations of 1.4 mm in diameter

title: milling degree
meaning: extent or degree by which the bran layer and germ have been removed

title: overmilled rice
meaning: rice grain from which the hull, the germ, and the bran layers have been completely removed

title: regular milled rice
meaning:
rice grain from which the hull, the germ, the outer bran layers and the greater part of the
inner bran layers have been removed but part of the lengthwise streaks of the bran layers may still be present on 15% to 40% of the sample grains

title: undermilled rice
meaning:
rice grain from which the hull, the germ, the outer bran layer, and the greater part of the inner bran layer have been removed, but part of the lengthwise streaks of the bran layer
may still be present on more than 40 % of the sample grains

title: well-milled rice
meaning: rice grain from which the hull, the germ, the outer bran layers, and the greater part of the inner bran layer have been removed, but part of the lengthwise streaks of the bran layers may still be present on less than 15% of the sample grains

title: bran
meaning: outer layer of the brown rice consisting of the aleurone cells covering the endosperm of the rice grain*

title: broken grains
meaning: grains that break in the process of milling which have a size of less than eight-tenth (8/10) of the average length of whole grain

title: household model
meaning: type of micromill with milling capacity of 50 kg/h to less than 100 kg/h

title: micromill
meaning: friction type rice mill performing simultaneous hulling and whitening operations and having a milling capacity of 50-250 kg/h

title: milled rice
meaning: grains obtained after the removal of hull and bran

title: percent head rice
meaning: ratio of the weight of grains that do not break in the process of milling and with a size of eight-tenth (8/10) or more of the whole grain to the total weight of milled rice, percent

title: rice hull
meaning: outermost rough covering of the palay grain (palea and lemma) consisting of the empty glumes, floral glumes and awn

title: village model
meaning: type of micromill with input capacity of 100-250 kg/h

title: primary method
meaning: method of grain moisture determination based on actual extraction of water either by convection heating (oven method) or distillation

title: secondary method
meaning:
method of grain moisture determination based on some characteristics of the grain sample such as electrical resistance and capacitance which are related to moisture
content and must be periodically calibrated against an official primary method

title: extraction rate
meaning: quantity of juice that the extractor can obtain per unit of time, expressed in kilogram per hour

title: juice quality
meaning: refers to the physical and chemical properties of juice extracted

title: juice recovery
meaning: ratio of the extracted juice and the total weight of the input crop, expressed in percent

title: meal
meaning: residues of the test materials after juice extraction

title: potential juice content
meaning: initial moisture content of the crop

title: extracting chamber
meaning: part of the multicrop juice extractor where juice extraction takes place

title: extraction recovery
meaning: total amount of extracted juice collected based on the extraction losses, expressed in percentage

title: juice
meaning: aqueous liquid expressed or extracted from crops cells or tissues

title: multicrop juice extractor
meaning: machine capable of extracting the juice of different crops

title: fineness
meaning: indicates the uniformity of grind in the resultant product

title: input time
meaning: time required to empty the hopper from full load per trial

title: milling efficiency
meaning: ratio between the amount of acceptable ground/milled product and the total milling recovery, expressed in percentage

title: milling recovery
meaning: ratio between the total amount of ground/milled product recovered and the total input materials, expressed in percentage

title: quality
meaning: refers to the fineness of the ground/milled product

title: sealed
meaning: free of openings that allow the entry or passage of moisture

title: collecting bin
meaning: part of the machine where the ground/milled products are being discharged

title: cyclone
meaning: part of the machine (usually made of cheesecloth) where the small or powdered solids are being separated and protected from the air

title: flour
meaning: finely ground or powdered foodstuffs from grains or other starchy plant foods used mainly in baking

title: food seasoning
meaning: an ingredient (as condiment, spice or herb) added to food primarily to enhance its flavor

title: milling chamber
meaning: part of the multicrop micromill where milling/grinding takes place

title: multicrop micromill
meaning: machine that grinds dried product meal of various crops into finer particles suitable for the purpose of food seasoning or as flour

title: attrition mill
meaning: It consists of two roughed plates, one stationary and the other rotating. The material is reduced by crushing and shears

title: freshly harvested
meaning: crop condition stored not more than 2 days after harvest

title: machine efficiency
meaning: quantitative efficiency of the machine in cleaning and peeling crops, expressed in percent

title: mechanically damaged materials
meaning: materials that are damaged (i.e. bruises/scratched, broken, sliced, etc.) as a result of washing and peeling operation, expressed in percent

title: clean
meaning: practically free from dirt, stains, other foreign materials or absence of caked dirt on the rhizome or between segments of the rhizome and other crops

title: multicrop washer- peeler
meaning: machine that peels outer skin, or cleans and removes undesirable debris of ginger rhizomes, sweet potato, potato, arrow root, radish and carrot

title: rhizome
meaning: horizontally elongated subterranean stem, which forms roots on the lower side and shoots on the upper side of the nodes

title: effective capacity
meaning: washing-peeling capacity; the amount of washed and peeled crops per unit time during the actual washing-peeling operation time, expressed in kilogram per hour

title: washing drum assembly
meaning: a cylinder encased in a water container and rotating in a horizontal axis where crops are being loaded for the washing and peeling operation

title: water container
meaning: cylindrical container that holds the water and washing drum assembly

title: cracked kernel
meaning: kernel which shows signs of fissures or fractures

title: kernel
meaning: edible part of peanut

title: kernel-pod ratio
meaning: ratio of the weight of kernel to the weight of the pod, expressed as percent

title: main kernel outlet
meaning: outlet at which shelled kernel move out of the machine

title: net cracked kernel
meaning: difference between the percent cracked kernel taken before and after the shelling operation

title: partially-shelled pod
meaning: pod being left with kernels in it after shelling

title: pod
meaning: unbroken shell with kernel inside

title: shell outlet
meaning: outlet at which shells come out of the machine in case of the machine with blower(s)

title: shelling efficiency
meaning: shelled kernel received at all outlet with respect to the total kernel input expressed as percentage by weight

title: shelling recovery
meaning: ratio of the weight of the kernel collected at the main kernel outlet to the total kernel input expressed as percentage by weight

title: total kernel input
meaning: sum of the weight of kernel collected from the main kernel input and the clean kernel from the blower loss, separation loss, unshelled loss and scattering loss

title: unshelled loss
meaning: ratio of the weight of the kernel that remained in the shell after feeding into the shelling cylinder to the total kernel input expressed as percentage by weight

title: damaged kernel
meaning: wholly or partially broken and insect-damaged kernel

title: peanut sheller
meaning: machine used to remove kernels from the shell by breaking/splitting the pods

title: shell
meaning: hull of the pod

title: shell kernels
meaning: whole and damaged kernels freed from shell

title: whole kernel
meaning: unbroken and non-insect damaged kernel

title: clean shelled kernel
meaning: shelled kernel free from foreign matter

title: oscillating screen
meaning: wire mesh or perforated sheet metal used to separate large and/or small particles

title: total losses
meaning: sum of blower, separation, unshelled and scattering losses in a sheller, expressed in percent by weight

title: closed-frame cylinder
meaning: type of shelling cylinder formed by a rolled metal sheet/plate or formed by longitudinal bars adjacently arranged forming a continuous cylinder

title: corn cob
meaning: part of the ear corn where the kernels are attached

title: corn husker-sheller
meaning: machine used to remove the husk of corn ear, detach, separate and clean the corn kernels from the cobs in one operation

title: corn sheller
meaning: machine used to detach, separate and clean the corn kernels from the cobs

title: cylinder-type
meaning: type of shelling unit consisting of a cylinder with shelling elements such as knife bar or pegtooth

title: cracked kernels
meaning: kernels which show signs of fissures or fractures or splinters

title: disc-type
meaning: type of shelling unit consisting of a vertical disc with spiked surface

title: ear corn
meaning: dehusked corn; corn-in-cob; unshelled fruit of the corn plant where the husk has been removed mechanically or manually

title: hopper-fed type
meaning: type of corn sheller wherein the ear corn are fed into shelling chamber by gravity

title: kernel-ear corn ratio
meaning: ratio of the weight of the corn kernel present in the ear corn to the weight of the ear corn

title: open-frame cylinder
meaning: type of shelling cylinder where the shelling elements are attached to the equally spaced longitudinal bars arranged cylindrically

title: shelling cylinder
meaning: shelling drum; part of the shelling unit that rotates about an axis and it is equipped with pegs on its periphery

title: table-fed type
meaning: type of corn sheller wherein the ear corn are fed into shelling chamber with the application of external force

title: unshelled kernels
meaning: kernels that remain in the cob after shelling

title: blower
meaning: cleaning fan; rotary device which produces a draught of air across the chaffer and cleaning sieve(s) to blow away the materials or impurities lighter than grains

title: concave
meaning: concave-shaped, stationary element adjacent to the threshing cylinder or threshing rotor, fitted primarily to enhance threshing

title: crop elevator
meaning: auxiliary conveyor to assist in feeding the crop to the threshing cylinder

title: grain elevator
meaning: device which carries the grains from grain auger to grain tank or bin

title: grain loss
meaning: loss classified according to source, including all field losses attributable to the machine

title: grain pan
meaning: pan for collecting the clean grains after being passed through cleaning sieve(s) for conveying to grain auger

title: grain tank
meaning: bin; tank used to hold the threshed grain

title: header
meaning: feed table; portion of the combine comprising the mechanism for gathering, and cutting, stripping or picking the crop

title: header loss
meaning: grains that have fallen to the ground due to the machine's cutting operation

title: reel
meaning:
revolving slats or arms with battens arranged parallel to the cutter bar to hold the crop being cut by the knife and to push and guide it to a conveyor platform or feeder conveyor
auger

title: rice combine
meaning: mobile grain-harvesting machine for cutting, picking, stripping or picking up crop, threshing, separating, cleaning and conveying grain into a grain hopper and depositing harvest residue onto the ground

title: shaker shoe
meaning: shoe; oscillating structure which supports the cleaning sieve(s) and which may also support the chaffer and the chaffer extension

title: straw walker
meaning: assembly of two or more racks which agitates the straw and separates the remaining grains from straw

title: stripper beater
meaning:
rear beater; element placed on the rear side of the cylinder and above to rear ward of concave or concave grate extension or transition grate to assist the deflection of straw on
straw walker

title: destoner
meaning: auxiliary device used to separate stones from the palay and/or brown rice

title: paddy grader
meaning: auxiliary device used to classify paddy based on length and thickness

title: paddy separator
meaning: auxiliary device used to separate paddy from brown rice

title: polisher
meaning: pearler; auxiliary device used to remove the remaining small bran particles on the milled rice and gives it a glossy appearance

title: pre-cleaner
meaning: auxiliary device used to remove foreign matter/impurities from the paddy before milling

title: brown rice
meaning: dehulled palay (husk/hull removed) with the bran layer still intact

title: coefficient of hulling
meaning: measure of the ability of the machine to remove the hulls

title: coefficient of wholeness
meaning: measure of the ability of the machine to remove the hulls without breaking the grain

title: huller
meaning: dehuller; component of a rice mill that removes the hulls (palea and lemma) from the grains

title: hulling efficiency
meaning: product of the coefficient of hulling and the coefficient of wholeness of grains, expressed in percent

title: milling recovery index
meaning: ratio of the milling recovery obtained in actual testing, to the milling recovery obtained from the laboratory test mill

title: multi-pass rice mill
meaning: rice mill that employs a series of two or more whitening machines

title: percent head rice index
meaning: ratio of the percent head rice obtained in actual testing, to the percent head rice obtained from the laboratory test mill

title: cone "cono" type
meaning: type of rice mill having an under-runner stone disc huller and vertical cone whitener

title: rubber roll type
meaning: type of rice mill using rubber roll huller and utilizes friction and/or combination of other types of whitener

title: single-pass rice mill
meaning: rice mill that employs only one whitening machine

title: whitener
meaning: component of a rice mill that removes the bran layer in the brown rice

title: abrasive type
meaning: type of whitening machine consisting of a cylinder or cone coated with abrasive material such as emery stone or any similar materials enclosed in a perforated steel housing

title: friction type
meaning: type of whitening machine consisting of a ribbed cylinder enclosed in a perforated steel housing

title: cutting width
meaning: distance between two outermost divider tips

title: lodging angle
meaning: degree between the vertical line joining the center of the plant and the imaginary line where the stalk lodges

title: conveying loss
meaning: free grains that fall with the cut stalks during delivery and release at the side of the reaper during operation

title: rice reaper
meaning: machine that cuts and lays stalks of planted rice crop

title: reciprocating cutter knife
meaning: cutting mechanism consists of fixed lower knife and reciprocating upper knife wherein its movement is controlled by the crank connected to the gear box or belt drive

title: rotary knife
meaning: cutting mechanism consists of planetary type circular saw-toothed blade which rotates at the same time with the pick-up triangular frame

title: broken brown rice
meaning: grain that breaks in the process of dehulling which has a size of less than eighth-tenth (8/10) of the average length of the whole grain

title: metal drum core
meaning: cylinder where rubber is bonded

title: rubber roll
meaning: component of rice mill made of rubber bonded to an inner metal drum core use for hulling

title: rubber thickness
meaning: depth of the rubber bonded on the metal drum core

title: size
meaning: specified by the width, by the outside diameter and by the core diameter of the rubber roll

title: after-sales services
meaning: consists of parts and services provided by the manufacturers/ distributors/ dealers to the end user to ensure continuous serviceability of agricultural machinery

title: agricultural machinery
meaning: consists of agricultural tractors, self-propelled and pedestrian-operated machines, implements, and other equipment primarily used for agricultural operations

title: dealer
meaning: authorized representative of distributors and/or manufacturers to supply, trade, sell and service agricultural machinery to end-users

title: distributor
meaning: trading entity authorized by foreign and local suppliers and/or manufacturers to distribute agricultural machinery to dealers

title: manufacturer
meaning: Philippine-based, foreign or Filipino-owned, manufacturing entity involved in the production and distribution of agricultural machinery

title: warranty
meaning: guarantee; expressed assurance of the quality of the materials and workmanship of the products offered for sale or length of satisfactory use to be expected from a product under normal use

title: agricultural trailer
meaning: trailer designed to carry load for agricultural purposes without power of its own

title: gross load
meaning: gross weight; sum of payload and unladen mass of the trailer expressed in tons

title: ground clearance
meaning: vertical distance between the ground and the lowest point of the trailer

title: over-run brake
meaning: brake actuated by a compressive force in the hitch between a trailer and the towing tractor used to decelerate a moving trailer

title: parking brake
meaning: brake actuated by a pedal or lever to keep the trailer in stationary or parked position

title: payload
meaning: net weight; uniformly distributed maximum safe load which can be transported by the trailer expressed in tons

title: service brake
meaning: brake actuated by a pedal or lever to decelerate and stop a moving trailer

title: unladen mass
meaning: tare weight; mass of a trailer with all its usual fittings but without any load

title: wheel base
meaning: horizontal distance between foremost and rearmost axles or wheels measured at the center of the ground contact

title: wheel tread
meaning: wheel track; distance between the outermost wheels at the same axle measured at the center of ground contact

title: balanced trailer
meaning: agricultural trailer whose total load is supported by at least two axles with four or more wheels when detached from the towing tractor

title: semi-trailer
meaning: agricultural trailer with one axle and two wheels which, while in use, part of its load is transferred to the towing tractor and the rest of the load is carried on its axle

title: axle load
meaning: total static load supported by the wheels on the respective axle

title: tow eye
meaning: hitch point of the trailer's pullbar to be attached to the towing tractor

title: capacity
meaning: discharge at maximum efficiency

title: centrifugal pump
meaning:
type of pump with impellers rotating inside a closed casing which draws water into the pump through a central inlet opening and forces water out through a discharge outlet at
the periphery of the housing by means of centrifugal force

title: diffuser pump
meaning: turbine pump; type of centrifugal pump wherein the impeller is surrounded by diffuser vanes

title: volute pump
meaning: type of centrifugal pump with a casing made in the form of a spiral or volute curve

title: head
meaning: quantity used to express a form (or combination of forms) of the energy content of the liquid per unit weight of the liquid referred to any arbitrary datum

title: net positive suction head required (NPSHR)
meaning: performance characteristic required of the pump and is the NPSH at the pump inlet

title: pump
meaning: device used to lift or transfer water from one source to another

title: pump efficiency
meaning: ratio of the power output to the power input of the pump

title: priming
meaning: filling up the pump with water to displace or evacuate the entrapped air through a vent and create a liquid seal inside the casing

title: shaft power
meaning: power required to drive the pump shaft

title: water power
meaning: theoretical power required for pumping

title: single suction
meaning: type of pump has an impeller which has suction cavity on one side.

title: double suction
meaning: type of pump has an impeller which has suction cavity on both sides.

title: horizontal centrifugal pump
meaning: pump has a vertical impeller mounted on a horizontal shaft

title: vertical centrifugal pump
meaning: has a horizontal impeller mounted on a vertical shaft

title: non-self priming
meaning:
pump is one that needs to be manually primed. The system has to be filled initially by pouring water into the pipes from a bucket and thereafter the footvalve will keep water in
the system even after the pump is not used for some time.

title: self-priming pump
meaning: one that develops a vacuum sufficiently enough for atmospheric pressure to force the liquid to flow through the suction pipe into the pump casing without priming the pump.

title: axial flow pump
meaning: type of pump which develop most of the suction and discharge head by propelling or lifting action of the impeller vanes on the water

title: base plane
meaning: datum elevation; for horizontal shaft pumps, the distance from the level of water source to the centerline of the pump shaft; for vertical single suction pumps

title: cavitation
meaning: formation of cavities filled with water vapor due to local pressure drop and collapse as soon as the vapor bubbles reach regions of high pressure

title: friction head
meaning: equivalent head required to overcome the friction caused by the flow through the pipe and pipe fittings

title: mixed flow pump
meaning: type of pump which combines some of the features of both centrifugal and the axial flow pump and in which head is developed partly by the centrifugal force and partly by the lift of the vanes on the water

title: net positive suction head-NPSH
meaning: total suction head determined at the suction nozzle (corrected to pump center line) minus the vapor pressure of water at the pumping temperature

title: net positive suction head available (NPSHA)
meaning: NPSH as determined from the actual suction piping conditions

title: performance curve
meaning: curve which represents the interrelationship between capacity, head, power, NPSH and efficiency of the pump

title: static discharge head
meaning: vertical distance from the centerline of the pump to the discharge water level

title: static suction head
meaning: vertical distance from the free suction water level to the center line of the pump - NOTE It exists when the source of water supply is above the center line of the pump.

title: static suction lift
meaning: vertical distance from the free suction water level to the center line of the pump - NOTE It exists when the source of water supply is below the centerline of the pump.

title: total discharge head
meaning: sum of static discharge head, friction, and exit losses in the discharge piping plus the velocity head and pressure head at the point of discharge

title: total head
meaning: measure of energy increase imparted to the water by the pump and the algebraic difference between the total discharge head and total suction head

title: total suction head
meaning: vertical distance from the center line of the pump to the free level of the water to be pumped minus all friction losses in suction pipe and fittings, plus any pressure head existing on the suction supply

title: total suction lift
meaning: sum of static suction lift, friction and entrance losses in the suction piping

title: velocity head
meaning: pressure expressed in meters required to create the velocity of flow

title: disc harrow
meaning: implement consisting of two or four gangs of concave steel discs used for additional pulverization, mixing of pesticides and fertilizers into the soil, leveling and firming the soil, closing of air pockets and eradication of weeds

title: gang
meaning: set of concave discs, which is mounted on a common shaft and separated by a spool

title: concave head
meaning: circular concave steel plate used for cutting and inverting the soil

title: disc spacing
meaning: transverse distance between two adjacent disc edges

title: single-action disc harrow
meaning: consists of two gangs of discs, placed end-to-end at an angle, which throw the soil in opposite directions

title: tandem disc harrow
meaning: consists of two or more gangs, in which a set of two gangs follows behind the front gangs

title: offset disc harrow
meaning: consists of two gangs wherein one gang is located behind the other at an angle and the harrow is operated in an offset position in relation to the tractor centerline

title: frame
meaning: structure on which the gangs are fitted

title: gang angle
meaning: angle between the axis of gang and the line perpendicular to the direction of motion

title: gang angling mechanism
meaning: mechanism by which the gang angles are adjusted

title: gang axle
meaning: shaft on which a set of concave discs are fitted

title: hitch
meaning: portion of an implement designed to connect the implement to the power source

title: included angle
meaning: angle between the axes of two adjacent gangs

title: scraper
meaning: component which scrapes the soil adhering to the concave side of the disc

title: side angle
meaning: disc angle; angle, in the soil surface plane, between a tool axis and a line, which is perpendicular to the direction of travel

title: spool
meaning: flanged tube mounted on gang axle and placed between two discs to prevent the lateral movement of the discs on the shaft

title: width of cut - disc plow
meaning: transverse distance between the top or bottom cutting edges of the end discs

title: disc plow
meaning: rolling implement that cuts, lifts, inverts and throws to one side a layer of soil (furrow slice) to bury surface materials

title: four-wheel tractor
meaning: self-propelled, wheeled vehicle having two axles designed to carry, pull or propel agricultural implements and machines

title: headland
meaning: unplowed portion of the field at both ends of the furrow strip initially used for turning the draft animal/tractor and implement

title: moldboard plow
meaning: sliding implement that cuts, lifts, inverts and throws to one side a layer of soil (furrow slice) to bury surface materials

title: tilt angle
meaning: angle made by the disc with the vertical line

title: walking-type agricultural tractor
meaning: two-wheel tractor; hand tractor; pedestrian tractor; self-propelled machine having a single axle designed primarily to pull and propel trailed or mounted agricultural implements and machinery

title: width of cut - moldboard plow
meaning: distance measured from the wing of share to the point of share

title: concave disc
meaning: circular concave steel plate used for cutting and inverting the soil

title: concavity
meaning: vertical distance measured from the lowest point to the center of the disc when its concave side is placed on a flat surface

title: standard
meaning: beam; upright support which connects the shank to tillage implement frame

title: drilling rig
meaning: structural assembly which is used to drill holes for the purpose of water-well construction

title: drilling pipe
meaning: serves as an adaptor of the drill bit and conduit of water jet channel

title: drill bit
meaning: bit attached to the end of the drilling pipe which is directly in contact with the soil formation and serves as cutting device during drilling operation

title: main rig assembly
meaning: structure which supports the entire drilling system

title: surging stem
meaning: jetting stem; light weight pipes used during high velocity flow (jetting) operation

title: ampacity
meaning: current, in amperes, that a conductor can carry continuously under the conditions of use without exceeding its temperature rating

title: disconnecting means
meaning: switch; device, or group of devices, or other means by which the electric motor can be disconnected from the power supply

title: duty rating
meaning: time rating; refers to how frequently the motor is started and how long it will run each time it is started

title: electric motor
meaning: machine which converts electrical energy to mechanical energy

title: enclosure
meaning: case or housing which prevents the operator from accidental contact with energized parts and protect the motor from physical damage

title: frame designation
meaning: standardized motor mounting and shaft dimensions as established by National Electric Manufacturers Association (NEMA) or International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC)

title: locked-rotor current
meaning: maximum current required to start the motor

title: phase
meaning: number of individual voltages applied to the motor

title: three-phase
meaning: has three individual voltages applied to the motor

title: single-phase
meaning: has one voltage applied to the motor in the shape of a sine wave

title: rotor
meaning: armature winding; rotating part of electric motor which is typically constructed of a laminated steel core containing current-carrying copper wires

title: service factor
meaning: indicates the maximum load that can be successfully carried by the motor if it is to operate continuously and remain within a safe temperature range

title: stator
meaning: field poles; stationary part of electric motor consisting of copper windings which is placed in a laminated iron core

title: temperature rise
meaning: temperature of a motor operating under rated conditions, which is above ambient temperature

title: thermal protector
meaning: device which protects the motor against overheating due to overload or failure to start

title: torque
meaning: twisting or turning force produced by the motor

title: breakdown torque
meaning: pull out torque; maximum torque a motor can develop during overload without stalling

title: starting torque
meaning: locked rotor torque; motor torque at zero speed or the maximum torque required to start the load

title: application rate
meaning: amount of fertilizer applied in the field per unit area

title: delivery tube
meaning: part of the applicator which directs the distribution of fertilizer in the field

title: furrow closer
meaning: device which covers the distributed fertilizer in the furrow

title: furrow opener
meaning: device which makes the trench for the placement of fertilizer

title: granular fertilizer applicator
meaning: device for applying granular fertilizer

title: ground wheel
meaning: part of the fertilizer applicator which drives the metering device

title: metering device
meaning: mechanism used to regulate the amount of fertilizer to be discharged

title: field cultivator
meaning: implement for seedbed preparation, weed eradication, or fallow cultivation subsequent to some form of primary tillage, equipped with spring steel shanks

title: gage wheel
meaning: auxiliary component of the field cultivator that helps maintain uniform depth of cultivation and eliminate the need to set the tension with the three-point hitch every time you set a cultivator down

title: main frame
meaning: part of the field cultivator that holds the transverse toolbars and gauge wheels together

title: primary tillage
meaning: tillage which constitutes the initial major soil-working operation, normally designed to reduce soil strength, cover plant materials, and rearrange aggregates

title: secondary tillage
meaning: any group of different tillage operation, following primary tillage, which are designed to create refined soil conditions before the seed is planted

title: shank
meaning: structural member primarily used for attaching a tillage tool to a beam

title: shovel
meaning: spade-shaped, V-pointed soil working tool, which is used for various plowstocks, cultivators, grain drills, and soil scarifiers

title: spike
meaning: type of shovel used in hard soil conditions and for deeper penetration

title: sweep
meaning: type of shovel which is wing-shaped

title: transverse tool bar
meaning: part of the main frame to which shank assemblies are attached

title: float-assist tiller
meaning: a special type of walking-type agricultural tractor with a front-mounted tilling wheel and equipped with a flotation structure commonly used in waterlogged fields

title: floatation structure
meaning: float; hull; component of float-assist tiller which provides buoyancy for the tiller

title: tilling wheel
meaning: consists of a single or pair of wheels with radially mounted tilling blades attached to a common shaft or axle, supported and powered by the transmission

title: drawbar
meaning: bar at the rear of a tractor to which implements are hitched

title: drawbar power
meaning: power available at the drawbar sustainable over a distance of at least 20 meters

title: four-wheel drive
meaning: type of four-wheel tractor where power is transmitted to all wheels

title: two-wheel drive
meaning: type of four-wheel tractor where power is transmitted to rear wheels with small front wheels being pushed along

title: linchpin
meaning: retaining pin used in the hitch pins or studs

title: lower hitch point tire clearance
meaning: clearance (x) expressed as a radial dimension from the lower hitch point to the outside diameter of the tire with the implement in raised position and all side sway removed from the links

title: lower hutch point tractor clearance
meaning: horizontal dimension (z) between the rearmost parts of the tractor in the area between the two lower links and the horizontal line through the two lower hitch points throughout the range of vertical movement of the hitch points

title: power-take-off (PTO) shaft
meaning: external shaft usually at the rear of the tractor providing rotational power to implements and machines

title: PTO output power
meaning: power measured at the PTO shaft

title: roll-over protective structure
meaning: safety frame; roll-over protective device; two- or four-post structural frames primarily used to protect a seat-belted operator from being crushed in case the machine rolls over

title: three-point linkage
meaning: combination of one upper link and two lower links, each articulated to the tractor and the implement at opposite ends in order to connect the implement to the tractor

title: hitch point
meaning: articulated connection between a link and the implement

title: leveling adjustment
meaning: adjustment of the right lower link so that the hitch point may be moved vertically with respect to the left lower hitch point to provide an inclination of the implement

title: link point
meaning: articulated connection between a link and the tractor

title: upper hitch pin
meaning: pin that connects the upper link to the implement

title: upper link pin
meaning: pin that connects the upper link to the tractor

title: wheel tread
meaning: center to center distance between two front or rear wheels*

title: furrower
meaning: tillage implement resembling a double moldboard, one left wing and one right wing, used to make ridges and beds for planting and trenches for irrigation and drainage purposes

title: furrower bottom
meaning: lister bottom; working part of the furrower which includes the share and moldboard

title: blackband bottom
meaning: bottom that has smaller moldboards and are designed for better scouring in sticky soils

title: general-purpose bottom
meaning: bottom that has wider moldboards that works well at fairly high speeds in most soil conditions

title: hard-ground bottom
meaning: bottom that has very small share and moldboard designed for use in combination with disc openers to open hard-baked soils

title: moldboard
meaning: part of the furrower which lifts, inverts and throws laterally the layer of soil (furrow slice) in opposite directions

title: row marker
meaning: toolbar mounted device used to guide the operator in setting the furrower for the next pass to ensure uniform furrow spacing

title: share
meaning: part of the furrower that penetrates the soil and cuts the furrow slice horizontally

title: toolbar
meaning: structure to which the standards are mounted

title: agitator
meaning: part of the granule applicator that puts the granule in motion through continuous stirring or rotation

title: granule
meaning: generic term used for a small particle having a diameter ranging from 2 to 4 mm

title: granule applicator
meaning: agricultural tool used to apply granular fertilizers or pesticides to the field

title: hopper
meaning: part of granule applicator where granules are loaded

title: orifice
meaning: opening in the hopper or tank through which the granules pass through

title: power take-off shaft
meaning: external shaft on the rear of a tractor that provides rotational power to implements

title: spinner plate
meaning: part of the granule applicator that spreads the granules

title: check valve
meaning: valve inside the cylinder that holds the column of water in the draw pipe while the plunger is being pushed down after each up-stroke

title: discharge valve
meaning: valve attached to the discharge side (for lift type hand pump) or to the body of the cylinder (for force type hand pump) to allow one direction of flow of water only

title: hand pump
meaning: water pump powered by the movement of human arms

title: handle
meaning: lever that connects the pump rod to the pump head which often includes some mechanism to add counterweight to balance the weight of the water being lifted up the draw pipe

title: outlet
meaning: spout assembly of pump where water comes out

title: plunger
meaning: piston; part of the cylinder that is connected to the pump rod and which forces water up the draw pipe

title: pump head
meaning: pump assembly attached to the stand which contains the handle outlet assembly

title: pump rod
meaning: plunger rod; steel rod that connects the pump handle to the plunger assembly within the cylinder

title: pump stand
meaning: pedestal; base that attaches the hand pump to the ground and connects to the draw pipe

title: stroke
meaning: maximum distance that the plunger moves when the handle is moved

title: suction inlet
meaning: inlet to which the suction pipe is connected

title: suction pipe
meaning: pipe connecting the pump cylinder to the pump body where water moves up and out to the pump spout during pumping

title: type 1
meaning: hexagonal axle for walking-type agricultural tractor with a primemover size of up to 3.4 kW (4.5 hp) using diesel engine and up to 3.7 kW (5.0 hp) using gasoline engine

title: type 2
meaning:
hexagonal axle for walking-type agricultural tractor with a primemover size of 3.5 kW to
10.8 kW (4.6 hp - 14.5 hp) using diesel engine and 3.8 kW to 11.9 kW ( 5.1 hp - 16.0 hp) using gasoline engine

title: hitch assembly
meaning: structure made for attaching and/or supporting the implement

title: size of primemover
meaning: rated power rating of the primemover as specified by the manufacturer

title: lever-operated knapsack sprayer
meaning: backpack sprayer; sprayer which is operated manually with a lever and can be carried on the back of an operator for spraying

title: pressure chamber
meaning: component of the sprayer that evens out the fluctuations of the fluid pressure and induces more uniform flow of the sprayed liquid

title: tank capacity
meaning: maximum allowable volume of the liquid to fill the sprayer tank, when equipped with all its internal mounting

title: agricultural tractor
meaning: self-propelled, wheeled, track-laying or semi track-laying machine primarily designed to pull, push, carry and/or operate trailers or provide power to implements and machines used for agricultural, forestry and other related works

title: pedestrian-operated machine
meaning:
machine, having an integral power unit but normally operated by a pedestrian, designed to carry out agricultural operation, and which may also be operated from a seat on an
attachment or trailer

title: right-hand and left- hand
meaning: designations related to the operator when sitting on the operator's station

title: self-propelled machine
meaning: having one or more integral power units which propel and operate the machine, designed to carry out agricultural operations while on the move

title: grasping fork
meaning: part of the transplanting arm that picks rice seedlings

title: mechanical rice transplanter
meaning: machine designed for transplanting rice seedlings into a puddled and leveled field

title: paddle wheel
meaning: modified wheel used in transplanters to facilitate movement in the field

title: root-washed seedlings
meaning: rice seedlings grown in nurseries for transplanting wherein the roots are washed thoroughly to remove the soil

title: soil-bearing seedlings
meaning: rice seedlings grown in nursery for transplanting wherein the soil is retained with the roots for transplanting

title: transplanting arm
meaning: part of the mechanical transplanter that actuates picking and transplanting seedlings into a puddled field

title: transplanting
meaning: method of crop establishment for rice wherein rice seedlings grown in a nursery are pulled and transferred into puddled and leveled fields, 15 to 40 days after seeding

title: acceptance test
meaning: test carried out on samples selected from a lot for the purpose of acceptance of the lot

title: lot
meaning: in any consignment, all components or equipment under study

title: routine test
meaning: test carried out on each and every component or equipment to check the specifications which are likely to vary during production

title: type test
meaning: test carried out to prove conformity to the requirements of the relevant specification

title: blower range
meaning: distance from the nozzle at which spraying could be carried out

title: number median diameter
meaning: diameter of a droplet which will divide the number of sample droplets into two equal halves

title: volume median diameter
