meaning: diameter of a droplet which will divide the volume of sample droplets into two equal halves

title: cut-off valve
meaning: valve used to stop the flow of fluid

title: mist
meaning: fine drops of liquid, such as water or chemical pesticide, sprayed into the air

title: mist blower
meaning: equipment that sprays liquid in the form of mist

title: wand
meaning: part of the mist blower that connects the nozzle to the blower

title: colter
meaning: flat knife or revolving disc, mounted in front of the plow bottom, which cuts the soil vertically

title: frog
meaning: central part of the plow to which the share, moldboard and landside are attached

title: landside
meaning: part of the plow that presses and slides against the furrow wall, providing lateral stability during operation

title: landside heel
meaning: part, attached to the rear of a landside, which applies the vertical load of the plow bottom to the furrow bottom

title: general-purpose moldboard
meaning: plow bottom that has less curvature than the stubble and can be used easily for stubble, ordinary trash and stalk cover land

title: slatted moldboard
meaning: plow bottom which is used in sticky soils and soils that does not scour on solid moldboard

title: sod moldboard
meaning: plow bottom that has long, narrow and less sloping moldboard with a gradual twist that allows complete inversion of the furrow slice with minimum breakage

title: stubble moldboard
meaning: plow bottom that has short, broader and curved more abruptly along the top edge and is suited to work in soil which has been cultivated from year to year

title: left-hand plow
meaning: throws the furrow slice to the left of the plow's direction

title: right-hand plow
meaning: throws the furrow slice to the right of the plow's direction

title: two-way plow
meaning: reversible plow; throws the furrow slice either to the left or right of the plow's direction

title: plow bottom
meaning: plow body; working part of the plow which includes the share, moldboard, and landside, all attached to the frog

title: shin
meaning: leading edge of the moldboard located above the landside

title: horizontal suction
meaning: horizontal clearance; distance by which the point of the share is bent out of line with the landside to cut the proper furrow width

title: vertical suction
meaning: vertical clearance; distance by which the point of the share is bent downward for the plow to penetrate the soil to the proper depth

title: tailpiece
meaning: optional accessory, attached to the wing of the moldboard to improve inversion of the furrow slice

title: trash board
meaning: optional accessory, mounted above the shin, which deposits the upper edge of the furrow in the furrow bottom

title: lance
meaning: metallic tube that connects the nozzle to the hose of power sprayer

title: power sprayer
meaning: equipment powered by an electric motor or by an engine used to spray fertilizer or pesticide to a certain height

title: nozzle
meaning: tip of lance of the power sprayer where the chemical is sprayed out

title: pressure relief valve
meaning: component of the power sprayer used to regulate the pressure

title: runoff
meaning: overflow of water from the nozzle

title: adjusting ring
meaning: metal or rubber ring positioned to regulate the seeding rate

title: drum hopper
meaning: part of the seeder where the seeds are loaded and metered

title: drum seeder
meaning: planting equipment used for pre-germinated rice seeds for wet fields

title: seeding rate
meaning: amount of seeds discharged from the seeder per unit time or area

title: skid
meaning: part of the seeder which serves as a float to prevent the seeder from sinking

title: seat index point
meaning: point on the central vertical plane of the seat

title: base pressure
meaning:
pressure measured at a point on the riser with a distance of at least five times the nominal sprinkler inlet diameter from the last upstream direction change or change in pipe
crosssectional area

title: radius of throw
meaning: farthest distance measured from the sprinkler head centerline to a point at which liquid is deposited

title: rotating sprinkler head
meaning: device which by its rotating motion around its vertical axis distributes liquid over an area

title: grain seeder
meaning: planting equipment used to deposit seeds in the soil for crop production

title: field efficiency
meaning: ratio of effective field capacity to the theoretical field capacity

title: effective field capacity
meaning: actual rate of being able to plant a given area per unit of time

title: theoretical field capacity
meaning: computed rate of being able to plant a given area per unit of time

title: seed delivery rate
meaning: amount of seeds that can be planted per unit area

title: air-cooled
meaning: direct cooling system; system wherein air is used to remove excess heat from the engine through metal fins or shrouds which are located around the cylinder thus creating the flow of air to the engine body in order to maintain its operating temperature

title: cycle
meaning: series of events occurring one after the other in a definite order and repeats the events after the last one has occurred

title: four-stroke
meaning: piston requires four movements to complete one cycle

title: two-stroke cycle
meaning: piston requires two movements to complete one cycle

title: engine
meaning: heat engine; mechanical device that converts heat energy produced by combustion of fuel into mechanical energy

title: internal combustion engine
meaning: type of engine where the combustion of fuel takes place inside the cylinder

title: compression ignition engine
meaning: diesel engine; engine in which combustion is achieved by compressing the air until a high temperature is achieved to initiate combustion of fuel

title: spark ignition engine
meaning: gasoline engine; engine in which combustion occurs through the initiation of a spark on the compressed fuel and air mixture

title: overhead valve
meaning: arrangement of valves wherein the intake and exhaust valves are located in the cylinder head

title: side valves
meaning: arrangement of valves wherein the intake and exhaust valves are located on one side of the cylinder block

title: water-cooled
meaning: indirect cooling system; system in which water/liquid-coolant serves as the cooling medium which circulates in the water jackets to absorb the heat of the engine

title: auger head
meaning: drill bit; boring part of the soil auger

title: extension rod
meaning: accessory part of the soil auger to lengthen the reach of the tool

title: soil auger
meaning: tool used for displacing soil at various depths for soil research and analysis or for digging post holes by means of a rotating helical flighting

title: soil sampling auger
meaning: Type of soil auger with a diameter of at least 50 mm with provision for obtaining soil samples in the auger head through different soil types

title: soil boring auger
meaning: Type of soil auger designed for drilling holes in the soil

title: hand-operated type
meaning: Type of soil auger that makes use of human force to drill the soil

title: motor-powered
meaning: Type of soil auger that is powered by an electric motor or an engine to drill the soil

title: fluid-powered
meaning: Type of soil auger that is powered by either pneumatic or hydraulic pump to drill the soil

title: tillage action
meaning: action of a tillage tool in executing a specific form of soil manipulation

title: tillage objective
meaning: desired soil condition produced by one or more tillage operations

title: tillage requirement
meaning: soil physical conditions which can be produced by tillage and is necessary based on utilitarian and/or economic considerations

title: broadcast tillage
meaning: overall tillage; tillage of an entire area as contrasted to a partial tillage as in bands or strips

title: deep tillage
meaning: primary tillage operation which manipulates soil to a greater depth than 300 mm

title: earthmoving
meaning: tillage action and transport operations utilized to loosen, load, carry, and unload soil

title: land forming
meaning: tillage operation which move soil to create desired soil configurations

title: land grading
meaning: tillage operation which move soil to establish a desired soil elevation and slope

title: land planing
meaning: tillage operation that cuts and moves small layers of soil to provide smooth, refined surface condition

title: oriented tillage
meaning: tillage operation which are oriented in specific paths or directions with respect to the sun, prevailing winds, previous tillage actions, or field base lines

title: rotary tillage
meaning: tillage operation employing power-driven rotary action to cut, break up, and mix soil

title: soil cultivation
meaning: shallow tillage operation performed to promote growth of crop plants by creating a soil condition conducive to aeration, infiltration, and moisture conservation or to pest control

title: tillage
meaning: mechanical manipulation of soil for any desired purpose

title: tillage depth
meaning: tool depth; vertical distance from the initial soil surface to a specified point of penetration of the tool

title: conservation tillage
meaning: system that maintains a minimum of 30% residue cover on the soil surface after planting or maintains at least 1,100 kg/ha of flat small grain residue equivalent on the soil surface during the critical erosion period

title: conventional tillage
meaning: system traditionally performed in preparing a seedbed for a given crop and grown in a given geographical area

title: minimum tillage
meaning: system wherein least soil manipulation is performed

title: mulch tillage
meaning: system in which tillage of the total soil surface is performed in such a way that plant residue is specifically left on or near the soil surface

title: optimum tillage
meaning: idealized system which permits a maximized net return for a given crop under given conditions

title: precision tillage
meaning: subsoiling under the plant row prior to planting usually intended for subsurface drainage

title: reduced tillage
meaning: system in which the primary tillage operation is performed in conjunction with special planting procedures in order to reduce or eliminate secondary tillage operations

title: reservoir tillage
meaning: system in which a large number of depressions or small reservoirs are formed to hold rain or sprinkler applied water

title: ridge tillage
meaning: system in which the ridges are formed during cultivation or after harvest and maintained from year to year in the same location

title: strip tillage
meaning: system in which only isolated bands of soil is tilled

title: anchoring
meaning: tillage to partially bury and thereby prevent movement of materials such as plant residues or artificial mulches

title: bedding
meaning: ridging; listing; tillage which forms a ridge and furrow soil configuration

title: bulldozing
meaning: pushing or rolling of soil by a steeply inclined blade

title: chisel plowing
meaning: tillage in which a narrow curved shank is used

title: combined tillage operations
meaning: operations simultaneously utilizing two or more different types of tillage tools or implements (subsoil-lister, lister-planter, or plow-planter combinations) to simplify, control, or reduce the number of trips over a field

title: harrowing
meaning: operation which pulverizes, smoothens, and makes the soil ready for planting

title: incorporating
meaning: mixing; operation which mix or disperse foreign materials, such as pesticides, fertilizers or plant residues into the soil

title: middlebreaking
meaning: hilling; operation wherein a lister is used in a manner that forms a furrow midway between two previous rows of plants

title: off barring
meaning: operation that cuts and throws the soil away from the base of plants

title: moldboard plowing
meaning: operation which is performed to cut the soil with partial or complete soil inversion

title: residue processing
meaning: operation that cut, crush, anchor or otherwise handle residues in conjunction with soil manipulation

title: subsoiling
meaning: deep tillage, below 350 mm for the purpose of loosening soil for root growth and/or water movement

title: vertical mulching
meaning: operation in which a vertical band of mulching material is injected into the slit immediately behind a tillage tool shank

title: general-purpose tillage implement
meaning: implement performing functions simultaneously that of initial cutting, breaking and pulverizing the soil

title: plow-harrow
meaning: implement which works under the combined principles of the regular disc plow and harrow

title: rotary tiller
meaning: implement used for broadcast or strip tillage and is also used as chemical incorporator and as row crop cultivator

title: spiral plow
meaning: rotary plow; implement which consists of two horizontal power driven spiral flanged shafts which rotate vertically

title: primary tillage implement
meaning: implement used for cutting, displacing and/or shattering the soil to reduce soil strength and to bury or mix plant materials, pesticides, and fertilizers in the tillage layer

title: chisel plow
meaning: implement which shatters the soil without complete burial or mixing of surface materials

title: subsoiler
meaning: implement for intermittent tillage at depths sufficient to shatter compacted subsurface layers

title: secondary tillage implement
meaning: implement used for tilling the soil to a shallower depth than primary tillage implements, provide additional pulverization, mix pesticides and fertilizers into the soil, level and firm soil, close air pockets, and eradicate weeds

title: comb-tooth harrow
meaning: implement used for breaking clods after initial plowing, for subsequent operations prior to transplanting and for puddling and leveling

title: packer
meaning: implement for crushing soil clods and compacting the soil

title: roller-harrow
meaning: implement used for seedbed preparation which crushes soil clods and smooths and firms the soil surface

title: rotary how
meaning: implement for dislodging small weeds and grasses and for breaking soil crust and is used for fast, shallow cultivation before or soon after crop plants emerge

title: row crop cultivator
meaning: implement wherein the frame and cultivating tools are designed to adequately pass through standing crop rows without crop damage

title: spike-tooth harrow
meaning: implement consisting of long spikes attached rigidly to cross bars and staggered to attain maximum stirring and raking of soil

title: spring-tooth harrow
meaning: implement consisting of long, flat and curved teeth made of spring steel

title: cultivating tillage implement
meaning: implement performing shallow post-plant tillage to aid the crop by loosening the soil and/or by mechanical radication of undesired vegetation

title: continuous-tool bar cultivator
meaning: implement consisting of tool bars that extend across the top of the rows, which allow lateral adjustments of the tools for different row spacing

title: separated gang cultivator
meaning: implement consisting of tool bars that drop down between the rows to provide maximum vertical clearance for the plants

title: bed shaper
meaning: soil-handling implement which forms uniform ridges of soil to predetermined shapes

title: blade
meaning: soil-working tool, consisting of an edge and a surface, which is primarily designed to cut through the soil

title: coulter
meaning: circular, flat tool used to cut plant material and soil

title: draft
meaning: force to propel an implement in the direction of travel which is equal and opposite to drawbar pull

title: effective operating width
meaning: operating width excluding overlap

title: edge clearance angle
meaning: effective angle which is included between the line of travel and a line drawn through the back or nonsoil-working surface of the tool at its immediate edge

title: implement width
meaning: horizontal distance perpendicular to the direction of travel between the outermost edges of the implement

title: injector
meaning: implement used to insert materials into the soil

title: jointer
meaning: miniature plow attachment whose purpose is to turn over a small furrow slice directly ahead of the main moldboard plow bottom, to aid in covering trash

title: lateral tool spacing
meaning: horizontal distance between corresponding reference points on adjacent tools when projected upon a vertical plane perpendicular to the direction of travel

title: line of travel
meaning: line and direction along which the tillage implement travels

title: lister-planter
meaning:
combined tillage implement which is composed of a lister and a planting attachment to permit a single listing-seeding operation with the planter normally being operated in the
furrow

title: longitudinal tool spacing
meaning: horizontal distance between corresponding reference points of two tools when projected upon a vertical plane parallel to the direction of travel

title: mechanical tillage implement
meaning: single or groups of soil-working tools together with power transmission structure, control, and protection systems present as an integral part of the machine

title: horizontal clearance
meaning: distance measured between specified points on adjacent plow bottoms

title: vertical clearance
meaning: distance measured from cutting edge of share to nearest potentially obstructing member such as main truss (backbone), frame, beam, release mechanism, etc

title: operating overlap
meaning: distance perpendicular to the direction of travel that an implement reworks soil previously tilled

title: operating width
meaning: horizontal distance perpendicular to the direction of travel within which an implement performs its intended function

title: protected zone
meaning: soil and/or plant zone purposely protected by virtue of tool design, tool spacing or evasive tool movement

title: scouring
meaning: shedding; soil-tool reaction in which soil slides over the surface of the tillage tool without significant adhesion

title: side force
meaning: side draft; horizontal component of pull, perpendicular to the line of motion

title: soil-additive applicator
meaning: machine used to apply, or to apply and incorporate soil additives by means of tillage

title: soil-additive incorporator
meaning: machine used to mechanically incorporate or mix material into the soil

title: soil opener
meaning: tillage tool used to slice through soil and create an opening for the insertion of material such as seeds, pesticides, fertilizers

title: soil roller
meaning: rotating implement which pulverizes, firms or smooths soil by crushing or compacting

title: soil-sliding path
meaning: path along which one element of soil slides across a tillage tool

title: soil-sliding path length
meaning: length of the path along tillage tool upon which soil slides

title: soil-ascending angle
meaning: angle between the sliding path and the horizontal at any point along the sliding path

title: soil-sliding angle
meaning: angle at any point on the surface of a tool between the soil sliding path and a horizontal contour line constructed through the surface of the tool

title: soil-tool geometry
meaning: configuration of the soil-tool boundary wherein the overall shape is usually oriented with the direction of travel of the tool and the soil surface

title: soil-working surface
meaning: portions of tillage tools which are designed to be in contact with the soil

title: specific draft
meaning: unit draft; draft force of an implement per unit area of tilled cross-section

title: teeth
meaning: projections on tillage tools which serve to penetrate, grip, cut, or tear soil

title: tillage tool
meaning: individual soil-working element

title: complex tillage tools
meaning: tillage tools which rotate or move so that they present a varying boundary and contact area to the soil

title: dynamic tillage tools
meaning: tillage tools which are powered so that some of their movements are in direction other than along the line of travel

title: multi-powered tillage tools
meaning: tillage tools powered by more than one form of power, such as draft and rotating power, or draft and electrical power

title: simple tillage tools
meaning: tillage tools which present a reasonable constant boundary area to the soil

title: tool clearance
meaning: minimum distance in a specified direction between a point on the tool and the nearest potentially obstructing implement element

title: tool-operating width
meaning: maximum horizontal distance perpendicular to the line of motion over which a tool performs its intended function

title: tool orientation
meaning: position of the tool in a framework of cartesian coordinates which is usually oriented with the soil surface and the direction of travel

title: lift angle
meaning: rake angle; angle, in a vertical plane parallel to the direction of travel, between a tool axis and the soil surface

title: tool overlap
meaning: distance perpendicular to the direction of travel in which a tool operating width coincides with the operating width of another tool

title: tool-skip area
meaning: area of soil surface left undisturbed during passage of a tool

title: tool width
meaning: maximum horizontal projection of a tool in the soil perpendicular to the line of motion

title: vertical tool spacing
meaning: vertical distance between corresponding points on adjacent tools when projected upon a vertical plane parallel to the direction of travel

title: wings
meaning: projections attached to the sides of tillage tools to increase the volume of soil which can be disturbed

title: soil abrasion
meaning: scratching, cutting, or abrading of materials caused by the action of soil

title: soil adhesion
meaning: sticking of soil to objects such as tillage tools or wheels

title: soil compaction
meaning: act of reducing the specific volume of soil

title: soil cutting
meaning: separation of a soil mass by a slicing action

title: soil failure
meaning: alteration or destruction of a soil structural condition by mechanical forces such as in shearing, compression, or tearing

title: soil heaving
meaning: lifting or swelling of soil resulting from natural forces such as freezing

title: soil reaction
meaning: soil response to the application of mechanical forces

title: soil shatter
meaning: pulverization; general fragmentation of a soil mass resulting from the action of tillage forces

title: soil sliding
meaning: sliding of soil across a surface

title: throw
meaning: movement of soil in any direction as a result of kinetic energy imparted to the soil by the tillage tool

title: soil additive
meaning: foreign; materials, other than seeds, which are added to and/or incorporated in soil for directly influencing the soil condition or environment

title: adhered soil bodies
meaning: masses of soil (may be stationary or in a relatively slow motion) which adheres on soilworking surfaces and act as a part of the tool

title: compacted layer
meaning: hard pan; plow pan; plow soil; dense layer of soil immediately below tillage depth created by mechanical pressure and/or soil-shearing forces

title: concretions
meaning: soil structural units which are irreversibly cemented together

title: covering depth
meaning: thickness of soil with which materials are covered by an implement

title: foreign materials
meaning: all materials added to or mixed into soil, including residues, soil additives, and foreign bodies that have not originated in the soil's development

title: mechanical impedance
meaning: resistance to the movement of plant parts or tillage tools through soil that is caused by the mechanical strength of the soil

title: mechanical stability
meaning: mechanical strength; degree of resistance of soil to deformation

title: shear blocks
meaning: clods; blocks of soil which are sheared loose from the main soil mass by tillage tool action

title: shear surface
meaning: failure surfaces occurring where the soil has sheared

title: primary shear surfaces
meaning: initial and distinct surfaces appearing during failure which are caused mainly by shear

title: secondary shear surfaces
meaning: shear surfaces which result from the twisting, pushing, or tumbling of the soil after or during the initial displacement

title: soil aggregates
meaning: soil peds; agglomerations of primary soil particles which are produced by natural processes

title: tillability
meaning: degree of ease with which a soil may be manipulated for a specific purpose

title: back furrow
meaning: raised ridge left at the center of the strip of land, when plowing is started from center to side

title: dead furrow
meaning: open trench (about twice the width of one plow bottom) left in between the adjacent strips of land after finishing of plowing - NOTE It is formed when two adjacent furrow slices are thrown opposite each other.

title: furrow
meaning: trench left when the plow bottom cuts and turns the furrow slice

title: furrow crown
meaning: peak of the turned furrow slice

title: furrow depth
meaning: depth of depression below a specified (initial or subsequent) soil surface

title: furrow slice
meaning: soil mass cut, lifted, pulverized, inverted and thrown to one side of the plow bottom

title: furrow wall
meaning: undisturbed or unbroken side of the furrow

title: head land
meaning: unplowed soil at the end of the furrow strip

title: land
meaning: unplowed soil

title: ridge height
meaning: height of soil above a specified (initial or subsequent) soil surface

title: root bed
meaning: soil profile modified by tillage or amendments for use by plant roots

title: root zone
meaning: part of the soil profile exploited by the roots of plants

title: seedbed
meaning: soil zone which affects germination and emergence of seeds

title: soil density
meaning: weight of a unit volume of soil expressed on either a wet basis (including soil and water) or on a dry basis

title: lever assembly
meaning: mechanism that adjusts the tooth depth to fit the soil condition

title: runner
meaning: auxiliary part of spring-tooth harrow attached at the bottom of the main frame to facilitate easy turning

title: tooth
meaning: tine; part of the spring-tooth harrow that engages with the soil during operation

title: impact-driven sprinkler head
meaning: type of rotating sprinkler head which rotates using weighted or spring-loaded arm which is propelled by the liquid stream and hits the sprinkler body

title: sprinkler head
meaning: hydraulically operated mechanical device which discharges liquid through a nozzle

title: trajectory angle
meaning: angle of the liquid stream above a horizontal plane, as discharged from the sprinkler nozzle operating at the test pressure

title: part-circle sprinkler
meaning: rotating sprinkler designed to irrigate a sector of a circular area, either with or without the possibility of adjusting it to irrigate the entire circular area

title: range of effective pressure
meaning: pressure range between the minimum effective pressure, pmin, and the maximum effective pressure, pmax, declared by the manufacturer as the pressure range in which the sprinklers operate effectively.

title: ripper point
meaning: tool attached to the shank of the subsoiler to cut through the soil

title: wear shin
meaning: metal plate attached to the shank to reduce abrasion and enhance durability of the shank

title: feeder
meaning: person who aids in dropping sugarcane billets into the furrow

title: feeding shank
meaning: component of the sugarcane planter that cuts the sugarcane billets and drops it into the furrow

title: sugarcane billet
meaning: sugarcane stalks containing buds used as planting material

title: sugarcane planter
meaning: agricultural equipment used for planting sugarcane billets

title: semi-automatic sugarcane planter
meaning: Type of sugarcane planter that is capable of chopping sugarcanes into billets which are dropped into the furrows

title: manual sugarcane planter
meaning: Type of sugarcane planter that is not capable of chopping sugarcane but instead, requires pre-cut billets for planting

title: agricultural machines
meaning: consists of agricultural tractors, self-propelled and pedestrian-operated machines, implements, and combinations thereof primarily used for agricultural operations

title: symbol
meaning: visually perceptible figure used to transmit information independent of language

title: weeding efficiency
meaning: weeding index; percentage of weeds removed/destroyed per unit area

title: weeder
meaning: implement used to remove/destroy the weeds from an agricultural land

title: weeds
meaning: unwanted plants growing in a field competing with the main crop for nutrients, moisture and sunlight

title: damaged plants
meaning: plants injured (i.e. teared leaves, broken stems, and/or uprooted plant) that may affect crop growth

title: percent damage plants
meaning: percentage of plants injured during the weeding operation

title: pull type
meaning: traction type; capable of pulling various kinds of implements

title: rotary tilling type
meaning: type of walking-type agricultural tractor equipped with rotary tiller which cuts, breaks up, and mixes the soil and/or plant residues

title: applicable work
meaning: range of operations that could be performed by the machine as specified by the manufacturer

title: overall height
meaning: distance between the horizontal supporting surface and the horizontal plane touching the uppermost part of the tractor

title: overall length
meaning: distance between two vertical planes at right angles to the median plane of the tractor and touching its front and rear extremities

title: overall width
meaning: distance between two vertical planes parallel to the median plane of the tractor, each plane touching the outer-most point of the tractor on its respective side and with wheels set for minimum track

title: slip
meaning: ratio of the difference between the speed of pulley or belt and wheels or track with load, to the speed without load

title: tractor weight
meaning: total weight of the machine excluding ballast and implements with the fuel tank filled to 80 percent capacity and with normal amount of cooling water and lubricating oil (if engine is integrated with the tractor) and with specified wheels

title: fuel consumption
meaning: volume of fuel consumed by the engine

title: implement
meaning: any agricultural tool mounted on the tractor

title: nose angle
meaning: angle formed by the edges of the sweep

title: stem angle
meaning: angle formed by the shank or the shovel relative to the ground surface or to its base, respectively

title: transport height
meaning: overall height of the implement measured from the topmost point to its lowest point

title: transport length
meaning: overall length of the implement measured from the terminal point of the implement to the mounting point

title: wheel slip
meaning: reduction on the distance traveled by the tractor due to the attached implement

title: ballast
meaning: any material added to the tractor for the purpose of enhancing traction or stability

title: engine power
meaning: power measured at the flywheel or the crankshaft

title: maximum drawbar pull
meaning: mean maximum sustained pull of the tractor at the drawbar over a given distance, the pull being exerted horizontally and in the vertical plane containing the

title: radius of turning area
meaning: radius of clearance circle; radius of the smallest circle described by the outermost point of the tractor

title: radius of turning circle
meaning: radius of the smallest circle tangentially described by the median plane of the outermost wheel of the tractor

title: rated engine speed
meaning: speed in revolutions per minute specified by the manufacturer

title: specific fuel consumption
meaning: quantity of fuel consumed by an engine on the basis of per horsepower hour
